Gynecological symptom reports

Female, 40 - 59 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
40 2021-01-19 vaginal haemorrhage Pt was 18 weeks pregnant at the time of the vaccine. Second pregnancy. Pt is a physician. Pregnancy... Read more
Close
Pt was 18 weeks pregnant at the time of the vaccine. Second pregnancy. Pt is a physician. Pregnancy was entirely normal up to that time. On 1/18/2021, she began to have heavy vaginal bleeding probably due to a placental abruption and subsequently delivered at 18 weeks. Baby was stillborn. Ultrasound done 1/15/2021 normal. Lethal event for the fetus. The patient did well.
40 2021-01-31 intermenstrual bleeding Injection site soreness. Muscle aches in both thighs. Menstrual spotting on 1/28 & 1/29.
40 2021-02-10 menstruation delayed caused her period to be 6 days late
40 2021-02-11 abortion spontaneous About 12 hours after the vaccine I developed headache, fever 100.5, nausea and vomiting, and red ra... Read more
Close
About 12 hours after the vaccine I developed headache, fever 100.5, nausea and vomiting, and red rash across my chest up to my neck and under both breasts. All symptoms but the rash improved the following day. I went to have my 8 week pregnancy US 6 days after this second vaccine dose and there was no fetal heart rate. The baby measured 8.7mm and there should be a heart rate when the baby measures >7mm. I had all of my pregnancy symptoms up through the day of the vaccine and then they disappeared the day my vaccine symptoms improved. I do not have a history of miscarriage.
40 2021-02-16 menstrual disorder, heavy menstrual bleeding Headache, nausea, vomiting, sore arm, temp 102.8, chills began 1/08/2021 @ 9pm and lasted for 24 hou... Read more
Close
Headache, nausea, vomiting, sore arm, temp 102.8, chills began 1/08/2021 @ 9pm and lasted for 24 hours The next menstrual cycle was very heavy period, soaking heavy flow tampons every hour, large clots, and lasted 6 days from a typical mild flow 3 day period
40 2021-02-23 vaginal haemorrhage Headache lasting greater than 1 week, extreme fatigue and vaginal bleeding. Normally no headaches an... Read more
Close
Headache lasting greater than 1 week, extreme fatigue and vaginal bleeding. Normally no headaches and very regular cycle
40 2021-02-24 menstrual disorder Missed period
40 2021-02-24 menstruation irregular Irregular menstrual cycles (3 periods in 6 weeks); Irregular menstrual cycles (3 periods in 6 weeks)... Read more
Close
Irregular menstrual cycles (3 periods in 6 weeks); Irregular menstrual cycles (3 periods in 6 weeks) and extremely heavy bleeding; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse reported for herself. A 40 years old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EJ1685) via an unspecified route of administration on 21Dec2020 02:45 PM at age of 40 years old in left arm at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included there was no known allergies. No covid prior vaccination. And no other medical history. Patient was not pregnant. Concomitant medications were none. Previously there was no other vaccine in four weeks. No other medications in two weeks. Patient experienced irregular menstrual cycles (3 periods in 6 weeks) and extremely heavy bleeding with several clots starting one week after first vaccine. The adverse events started date was on 31Dec2020. Patient had the doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. There was no treatment. No covid tested post vaccination. Outcome of events were unknown. Patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (lot number= EL1283) on 11Jan2021 09:15 AM in left arm for covid-19 immunisation.
40 2021-02-28 abortion spontaneous, vaginal haemorrhage I was about 9 weeks pregnant with no complications at the time of my second vaccination. Estimated ... Read more
Close
I was about 9 weeks pregnant with no complications at the time of my second vaccination. Estimated due date was 08/24/2021. I began bleeding and cramping and having headaches approximately 10 days after my second dose. I sought medical attention and was told that my baby no longer had a heart beat and that growth (based on ultrasound) had stopped around the 9 week mark. I had medical assistance to physically miscarry the deceased fetus. I have one healthy living son (2 years, 4 months old) who was delivered without complications naturally.
40 2021-02-28 intermenstrual bleeding pain at injection site, myalgia, severe headache, joint pain x 3 weeks, psoriasis flare, carpal tunn... Read more
Close
pain at injection site, myalgia, severe headache, joint pain x 3 weeks, psoriasis flare, carpal tunnel syndrome flare, chills, menstrual spotting, ovarian cyst
40 2021-03-07 menstruation irregular High Blood Pressure (170/78) I do not have hypertension. Irregular vaginal bleeding. Starting bleedi... Read more
Close
High Blood Pressure (170/78) I do not have hypertension. Irregular vaginal bleeding. Starting bleeding mid cycle for a day. This has never happened to me. I have a normal menstrual cycle.
40 2021-03-09 breast tenderness The patient reports fever, chills, body aches, diarrhea, left axillary lymph node enlargement, and l... Read more
Close
The patient reports fever, chills, body aches, diarrhea, left axillary lymph node enlargement, and left breast tenderness following first dose of Pfizer vaccine. Constitutional symptoms lasted less than 1 week and were managed conservatively. The left axillary lymph node and left breast remained painful and enlarged for approximately 1 month.
40 2021-03-12 menstrual disorder Severe sore breasts and menstrual abnormalities
40 2021-03-13 intermenstrual bleeding Starting within 6-8 hours of the vaccinations, I began some menstrual spotting. This has been ongoin... Read more
Close
Starting within 6-8 hours of the vaccinations, I began some menstrual spotting. This has been ongoing lightly for the two days following the vaccination. Initially it was just a tiny bit of pinkish discharge noticed after using the bathroom, but now its is more of a very light menstrual flow. It should be another two weeks before my cycle returns, so this is way off schedule. I cannot think if anything else that has changed and would cause this.
40 2021-03-20 menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding, infrequent menstrual cycles EXTREMELY HEAVY MENSTRUAL BLEEDING OCCURED ON THE DAY OF THE SHOT, CLUMPS OF BLOOD WERE RELEASED AN... Read more
Close
EXTREMELY HEAVY MENSTRUAL BLEEDING OCCURED ON THE DAY OF THE SHOT, CLUMPS OF BLOOD WERE RELEASED AND THIS HEAVY CLUMP MENSTRUATION LASTED FOR OVER 2 WEEKS, LEADING ME TO SEEK MEDICAL HELP. PERIOD LASTED 3 WEEKS AND MENSTRUATION HAS BEEN IRREGULAR EVER SINCE
40 2021-03-21 menstrual disorder Two days after the vaccine, my right foot started to feel weird - felt wet sometimes or felt tingly.... Read more
Close
Two days after the vaccine, my right foot started to feel weird - felt wet sometimes or felt tingly. My foot was not swollen. I still have those weird sensations 18 days after getting the vaccine. Also, I had many small blood clots during my first menstruation after the vaccine (13 days after vaccine), which is not normal for me.
40 2021-03-25 menstruation irregular This will seem trivial in terms of reactions, but my period came 9 days early. If my cycle was a cou... Read more
Close
This will seem trivial in terms of reactions, but my period came 9 days early. If my cycle was a country, it would be Germany because my internal trains run on time without fail. However, the morning of 3-23-21, my period started. It is so out of the ordinary and I have become aware that I'm not the only woman with this issue after receiving the vaccine.
40 2021-03-25 vaginal haemorrhage, abortion spontaneous My first dose was 1/14. I found out I was pregnant on 1/26/21 and I miscarried at about 10 weeks. Ab... Read more
Close
My first dose was 1/14. I found out I was pregnant on 1/26/21 and I miscarried at about 10 weeks. About 15 mins after I got the vaccine, I had a racing heartrate and my palms were hot, but it went away. Around 3pm, I had a right frontal headache. I took a nap and it went away. About 5am Fri, I woke up to severe arm pain and it felt like I was being stabbed in the stomach. I took about 400mg of Ibuprofen, went to sleep and was fine when I woke up. About 5pm Friday, I began having vaginal bleeding. I called my doctor and was able to get in on Feb 11th. At my OB/GYN appointment, they tested my blood and urine, which confirmed my pregnancy. The NP examined me and told me that the bleeding was coming from my cervix, so they sent me for an ultrasound the following week. That's when I was given my calculated date of 10 weeks. A gestational sac was observed, but they weren't sure if a fetus was present. I had to see my doctor every week since I was still bleeding and that continued until March 18th, when I lost the pregnancy completely. I took my specimen to the doctor the following day. They told me that they were sending it out to be tested, but I'm not sure if the results are back. They did confirm that it was a fetus.
40 2021-03-26 menstrual cramps Making my endmetrios worse. I have never been in this much pain on a period. It is also making my ... Read more
Close
Making my endmetrios worse. I have never been in this much pain on a period. It is also making my bone pains worse and spreading it. They used to mainly happen in the arm and leg now it is everywhere.
40 2021-03-26 menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding I started my period two days after receiving the shot, which was two weeks earlier than expected. Fl... Read more
Close
I started my period two days after receiving the shot, which was two weeks earlier than expected. Flow was unusually heavy and very clotted - all abnormal for me. While I may have felt some fatigue from the shot, I never felt ill in any way. I also never felt any of the points of pain I might feel with my normal period, such as sore breasts prior to my period and cramps in my upper legs when it arrived. I only had a sore arm for a day where I received the shot.
40 2021-03-27 breast swelling Significant pain in both shoulders and neck. Bilateral shoulder pain has lasted for 3.5 weeks despit... Read more
Close
Significant pain in both shoulders and neck. Bilateral shoulder pain has lasted for 3.5 weeks despite only receiving vaccine in left arm, both times. Pain feels arthritic in nature and has made it hard to function. After the first shot, I got my period early and after the second shot, I have not had my period/missed a period (I have never missed a period before in my life except when pregnant 6 years ago). Also had left breast swelling that lasted around 1 week after the second shot.
40 2021-03-30 heavy menstrual bleeding, abnormally short menstrual cycles Period started early and was heavier and lasted longer than normal. Also developed rash on arm near... Read more
Close
Period started early and was heavier and lasted longer than normal. Also developed rash on arm near injection site. Both resolved within 7 days.
40 2021-03-31 heavy menstrual bleeding, menstruation irregular Early periods (now every 2 weeks) and heavier than usual since receiving the second dose. They are s... Read more
Close
Early periods (now every 2 weeks) and heavier than usual since receiving the second dose. They are still currently irregular.
40 2021-04-04 breast tenderness Facial swelling at site of fillers Pain/tenderness in left armpit Pain/tenderness in left breast Hea... Read more
Close
Facial swelling at site of fillers Pain/tenderness in left armpit Pain/tenderness in left breast Headache Neck pain
40 2021-04-04 menstrual disorder, heavy menstrual bleeding I have been amenorrheic since the birth of my child (March 2019, this is my third child and I have ... Read more
Close
I have been amenorrheic since the birth of my child (March 2019, this is my third child and I have previously remained amenorrheic until I completely finished nursing. My toddler still nurses 2-4 times daily) the day after my shot I had started menstration very suddenly and very heavily. I was so surprised by the volume, I use a menstrual cup with a 1 ounce volume and over the course of six (a normal period for me is 3 ) days I measured 9 ounces of flow. This period was sudden, twice as long and twice as heavy as usual.
40 2021-04-05 abortion spontaneous I had a miscarriage on 4/2 estimated and my estimated date of delivery 11/7/2021.
40 2021-04-06 abortion spontaneous, vaginal haemorrhage The next morning after I had arm pain and was very fatigued which lasted about a week. On 2/27 I s... Read more
Close
The next morning after I had arm pain and was very fatigued which lasted about a week. On 2/27 I started experiencing on and off vaginal bleeding but drs had no treatment they could provide. I was diagnosed with a threathened miscarrage and on 3/22/2021 I miscarried. EDD-11/7/2021. There were several bouts of bloodwork perfomed which were normal until the miscarrage occurred and all ultrasounds were normal until the 3rd which showed the miscarriage.
40 2021-04-06 abortion spontaneous Original Due Date: 11/4/2021. Miscarriage discovered 4/5/2021 and suspected to have occurred around... Read more
Close
Original Due Date: 11/4/2021. Miscarriage discovered 4/5/2021 and suspected to have occurred around 3/20/2021 (baby measured 7weeks,1 day on ultrasound). There were no indications of miscarriage before the ultrasound 4/5/201. Neither me, the patient, nor my doctor believe the miscarriage was a result of the vaccine but as it occurred a few weeks after I received the second dose in the series I felt it should be reported. I was approximately 4 weeks pregnant at the time of my second dose.
40 2021-04-06 abnormally short menstrual cycles Period started 2 days later and lasted for 7 days (it wasn?t due for another 3 weeks)
40 2021-04-09 heavy menstrual bleeding Wed Mar 31 - day of shot Stiff neck on side of shot Sore arm on shot site Heavy period w painful cra... Read more
Close
Wed Mar 31 - day of shot Stiff neck on side of shot Sore arm on shot site Heavy period w painful cramps for two days Swollen, painful lymph node in neck on same side as stiff neck and same side as shot - visit to chiropractor following day where it was numbed with bengay type product and vigorously rubbed. As of Saturday, Apr 10 pain and swollen lymph node still present but pain significantly less.
40 2021-04-11 menstruation delayed 4/8/21-Very stiff neck, pain level 8. Hard to move. Improved the following day. Did not take NSAIDS.... Read more
Close
4/8/21-Very stiff neck, pain level 8. Hard to move. Improved the following day. Did not take NSAIDS. Developed constipation. Developed a migraine (to be expected) 4/10/21-developed "Covid Arm" rash. Raised red itchy rash. 4/11/21-rash grew to size of silver dollar, didn't respond to topical hydrocortisone, took benadryl. 4/12/21-rash has settled down some but is still present. Having continued issues with constipation (was not an issue until the vaccine). Period is late, not at risk for being pregnant.
40 2021-04-11 menstruation irregular I ovulated and got my monthly menses one week early. My menses was otherwise normal, with normal flo... Read more
Close
I ovulated and got my monthly menses one week early. My menses was otherwise normal, with normal flow and duration.
40 2021-04-12 heavy menstrual bleeding Extremely heavy (abnormal) menstrual bleeding, muscle aches, fatigue
40 2021-04-13 abortion spontaneous Pregnancy history: 2 previous healthy children. Current pregnancy was to be due Nov. 4, 2021, had se... Read more
Close
Pregnancy history: 2 previous healthy children. Current pregnancy was to be due Nov. 4, 2021, had second shot when 7 weeks pregnant, heard heartbeat at 8 weeks, went to get checked at 11 weeks and it was measured that I miscarried at 8 weeks, exactly one week after receiving the second shot.
40 2021-04-13 menstruation irregular After the second dose I got my usually very regular period 10 days early. I also had breast soreness... Read more
Close
After the second dose I got my usually very regular period 10 days early. I also had breast soreness for about 3 weeks, starting a few days after the second dose. I think it is important for you to look into what about the vaccine could trigger women's periods to change.
40 2021-04-15 menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual cramps Menstrual cycle began 8 days early with unusual heaviness and cramping. Menstrual cycle has been no... Read more
Close
Menstrual cycle began 8 days early with unusual heaviness and cramping. Menstrual cycle has been normal for years.
40 2021-04-17 breast tenderness At approximately 6pm on 4/16/21, I began feeling as if I were in a fog (second dose of COVID-19 vacc... Read more
Close
At approximately 6pm on 4/16/21, I began feeling as if I were in a fog (second dose of COVID-19 vaccine received at 10:30am previous day). I began to feel weak and tired; all I wanted to do was lay down. I laid in bed and took my temperature via ear. 100.8 in the right ear and a reading of 101.2 in the left ear (I've not had a fever since maybe 12 years of age). I was also experiencing a headache (back of head) and neck discomfort. I felt hot, specifically ears and face. I took 400mg of ibuprofen at approximately 7pm and 1000mg of acetaminophen at approximately 10pm. by 10:30 my temp was 98.9. I woke up at 1:30am on 4/17/21 and was completely drenched I sweat. I assumed this was from the fever break but I woke up again at approximately 4am drenched again. After waking and getting up around 8am on 4/17/21, I felt great; back to normal. I went about my day. I woke again around 1:30am on 4/18/21 with a sore neck and the back, lower area of the head hurting (this wasn't the same feeling as having a stiff neck or laying in an awkward position). When I sat up, I felt some sore, throbbing on the top of my head which then subsided. I woke again at 4:30am with the same issue. I was also, again, completely drenched in sweat but no fever this time that I am aware of. My pajamas were soaked. I felt some relief with the head and neck discomfort when I got up at 6;30am. As I type this now, my head and neck feel basically normal. I also wish to report that in addition to injection site soreness which I think is always to be expected, I have been experiencing quite a bit of soreness and discomfort under my left arm. It runs down my left side from my arm pit to the side of my left breast. This area has been sore and tender since the evening of the day I received the shot (4/15/21). I'm assuming this could be due to stolen lymph nodes which I was told by a health care professional, could be a side effect of the vaccine.
40 2021-04-18 heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual cramps, menstrual disorder After the 2nd shot, my period came a week early and was unusually heavy. The cramping and clotting i... Read more
Close
After the 2nd shot, my period came a week early and was unusually heavy. The cramping and clotting is always over by day 3, and this time it was still continuing on day 4. There was enough clotting and blood loss that I was concerned for my health. On day 4, I was seeing 4-6 clots every time I changed my pad.
40 2021-04-19 breast swelling Arm started hurting around three hours after the first shot. By 9pm that night the pain had spread ... Read more
Close
Arm started hurting around three hours after the first shot. By 9pm that night the pain had spread to my neck and shoulder on the left side and I was not able to turn my head. My left breast also swelled up. This lasted for three days. The second day, I experienced blood pressure flutters if I stood up to fast or drank anything cold, this last only for a day.
40 2021-04-19 heavy menstrual bleeding I am a breastfeeding mother. I almost exclusively pump and bottle feed. I have not had a menstrual c... Read more
Close
I am a breastfeeding mother. I almost exclusively pump and bottle feed. I have not had a menstrual cycle since my child was born in October because of this. 72 hours after getting this vaccine, I started bleeding heavily. I am also not producing as much milk as I was before the vaccination. Prior to the vaccine I was pumping a total of 6 ounces every 4 hours. After the vaccine I have been pumping about 4 ounces every 4 hours. I have not had any change in my eating or drinking habits that would account for this loss of milk output. I also had a headache and sore arm but that was to be expected. These two issues have since resolved. The bleeding and loss of milk production are ongoing.
40 2021-04-20 heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual disorder After first vaccination, my period came a week early which is does not happen at all. With in a cou... Read more
Close
After first vaccination, my period came a week early which is does not happen at all. With in a couple hours after my second shot, what was a light period became very heavy. The period continued every day at varying levels from spotting to heavy for exactly 6 weeks with only a handful of days (3-5) with no bleeding during that time. At times it was so heavy it leaked in my bed and on my couch which is abnormal. There were several days that were heavy and also contained a lot of clumps/clots.
40 2021-04-20 menstruation delayed, heavy menstrual bleeding Heavy period following the first dose, and missed period with high fsh jumping from 7 to 30 after se... Read more
Close
Heavy period following the first dose, and missed period with high fsh jumping from 7 to 30 after second dose!!!! Other women are reporting the same effects.
40 2021-04-21 intermenstrual bleeding Menstrual spotting following vaccine.
40 2021-04-21 vaginal haemorrhage Pt went to the ER on 4/19/21 with vaginal bleeding and cramping at approx. 6 wks gestation per LMP. ... Read more
Close
Pt went to the ER on 4/19/21 with vaginal bleeding and cramping at approx. 6 wks gestation per LMP. HCG >7,000 on 4/19/21. Presented to clinic on 4/22/21 with chills, nausea, vaginal bleeding, sent for u/s, no IUP seen, HCG today 500.
40 2021-04-22 vaginal haemorrhage, heavy menstrual bleeding I got my period on April 1, and in 30 years of menstruating, it was the worst period I've ever had. ... Read more
Close
I got my period on April 1, and in 30 years of menstruating, it was the worst period I've ever had. I bled for 16 days straight with no let up, went through two boxes of super plus tampons and a bag of extra long pads (I normally bleed for 5-6 days with only one heavy day, use a mix of super and regular tampons, about 15-20 total). I passed large blood clots almost every day of this long period (never happened for me before).
40 2021-04-23 menstrual disorder Vertigo, presyncope, migraine, menstruation, back ache, nausea, tingling In the fingers, tinnitus
40 2021-04-23 menstruation delayed Skipped menstrual cycle. I am not pregnant, it would be impossible due to no intercourse and permane... Read more
Close
Skipped menstrual cycle. I am not pregnant, it would be impossible due to no intercourse and permanent birth control. As of this writing, I am 7 days late for my normal cycle.
40 2021-04-24 menstruation irregular My Period/menstruation started Not sure if in relation to getting my vaccine today. Period is a w... Read more
Close
My Period/menstruation started Not sure if in relation to getting my vaccine today. Period is a week early and got vaccinated earlier today
40 2021-04-25 menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding Menstruation- onset approximately 3 weeks early, heavier than normal for first 2 days. Accompanied b... Read more
Close
Menstruation- onset approximately 3 weeks early, heavier than normal for first 2 days. Accompanied by severe cramping in lower left and right abdomen, loss of appetite and nausea. Day 3 of menstrual cycle today, now only spotting but severe cramps and loss of appetite and nausea continues.
40 2021-04-27 heavy menstrual bleeding Super heavy period/bleeding through an overnight pad every 2-3 hours; This is a spontaneous report f... Read more
Close
Super heavy period/bleeding through an overnight pad every 2-3 hours; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) reported that a 40-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EW0153), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 08Apr2021 14:45 (at the age of 40-years-old) as a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The vaccine was administered at the Pharmacy/drug store. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient medical history included low progesterone and low thyroid both from an unknown date. The patient did not had covid-19 prior vaccination. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 10Apr2021, the patient had super heavy period. She was bleeding through an overnight pad every 2-3 hours. They were supposed to last between 10-12 hours. This lasted for almost 2 days, unfortunately if was during the weekend or she would have sought medical help from her doctor. The patient did not received any treatment for the reported event. Not covid-19 tested post vaccination. The outcome of the event was recovered on 12Apr2021.

40 2021-04-28 menstrual disorder Cervical radiculopathy; muscle spasms; neurological pain down right arm; bursitis right elbow; menst... Read more
Close
Cervical radiculopathy; muscle spasms; neurological pain down right arm; bursitis right elbow; menstrual changes - ovarian cyst; menstrual changes - ovarian cyst; carpal tunnel; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 40-year-old non-pregnant female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), first dose via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left arm on 28Dec2020 10:00 (lot number and expiration date were not reported) as single dose (at the age of 40-years-old) for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient was vaccinated in a hospital. The patient had no medical history and no known allergies. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient had no other vaccines in four weeks. The patient did not have COVID prior to vaccination. On 01Jan2021 at 6 pm, the patient experienced cervical radiculopathy, muscle spasms, neurological pain down right arm, bursitis right elbow, menstrual changes - ovarian cyst and carpal tunnel. The adverse events resulted in a doctor/healthcare professional clinic visit and was considered a disability/permanent damage. The patient received treatment of "PT, Mobic, soma, ultram and trigger point injection. The patient has not recovered from the events. The patient had a negative nasal swab test on 16Jan2021. The patient received the second dose administered in the left arm on 19Jan2021 (lot number and expiration date were not reported) at a single dose. Information about the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: The events cervical radiculopathy, muscle spasms, neurological pain down right arm, bursitis right elbow, menstrual changes, ovarian cyst and carpal tunnel most likely represent intercurrent medical conditions that are assessed as unrelated to BNT162B2. The case will be reassessed when additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

My menstrual cycle is off-course since I received my vaccines. My cycle is consistently 27-28 days long for years, but I started my period 3 days early on March 22, 2021, after the first vaccine, and have not gotten a period since then. It has now been 38 days since the start of my last period. I took a pregnancy test at my doctor's office yesterday, and it was negative.

Close
The evening of the vaccine I started getting sore ovaries, which continued for about 3 days, waking me up that first night with the pain. It felt like they were hot and aching, like they were working very hard, something I haven't experienced before. This was 5 days after my last period finished. I had spotting the next day, which I never have, and then my breasts became very sore, lumpy and tender for the next week or more - very concerning as I have had a fibroadenoma before. Symptoms were similar to being pregnant, but I have just started my next period, and did a pregnancy test which came back negative. I have also had ongoing light tinnitus, which started a few days after the vaccine. Again, I haven't had this before, and it has been almost 3 weeks now and it is still at the same intensity. I am very worried about getting the second vaccine next week.

The patient's medical history was not reported. No known allergies. The patient's concomitant medication includes an unspecified multivitamin. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient had no known allergies. The patient had no covid-19 prior vaccination. The patient previously received the first dose of (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8732), administered in arm left on 24Mar2021 11:00 AM (at the age of 40-years-old) for covid-19 immunization. The clots and heavy bleeding subsided by 6am. This has never happened to her before in her life so it was most likely vaccine related. She contacted her PCP who told her to see her OBGYN ASAP. I experienced a miscarriage in February 2021 and did not menstruate after that (though my normal cycle was 21-28 days). I started menstruating unexpectedly 2 days after my second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. I would think it might be a coincidence except I've heard from a lot of other women that their cycles were affected by the vaccine. So I thought I'd offer the feedback. I believe the vaccine may have triggered early menstruation for me. Additionally I believe I may have passed remaining pregnancy tissue during this unexpected menstruation.

Since then, I have not gotten another period but I have had extreme mood swings, period of uncontrollable crying (not linked to any other event in my life), intense fibroid pain, constant hormonal acne, new cold sores popping up almost every morning and constant recurring yeast infections. Nothing was or is different about my health, lifestyle, medications or any other factor other than the vaccine.

Worth noting the reason I was hyper aware that my period was late is 1) it has never been late in my entire life and I am 41 years old. 2) I use an app to track my cycle and it kept alerting me that it was late. I am on birth control and knew that I was not pregnant, however, it caused distress because I didn't know what was wrong with me and no one wants to have severe PMS for 10 days with no relief in sight.

40 2021-06-03 menstrual disorder I started menstruating one week following the first dose of my vaccine.; This is a spontaneous repor... Read more
Close
I started menstruating one week following the first dose of my vaccine.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient). A 40-years-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, lot number: EW0186) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 17May2021 (at the age of 40-years-old and not pregnant at the time of vaccination) at 12:45 PM as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included Subglottic stenosis, start and stop date not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Patient received birth control medications within 2 weeks of vaccination with no drug name. Relevant past drug history was reported as None known. On 26May2021 at 06:30, the patient had started menstruating one week following the first dose of my vaccine. She was taking her birth control correctly and had no physical symptoms leading up to the breakthrough bleeding. Patient was not on prolonged hospitalization. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. No treatment was received for event caused. The outcome of event at the time of last observation was Recovering/Resolving.

Close
pain in my right boob; maybe it is swollen; aching in my upper right arm; burning pain in my joints of the vaccinated arm; extreme tiredness; all joints in my arm began to sting; extremely nauseous; sweaty; light-headed/mild dizzy spells; unable to think clearly; sudden down in blood sugar; foggy-headed; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 40-years-old non-pregnant female patient received bnt162b2(PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection; Lot Number: EN6200), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 02Mar2021 13:30 as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Patient did not receive any vaccine in four weeks and not had COVID prior vaccination. Medical history included high blood sugar, asthma, scarlet fever survivor and patient had known allergy to latex. Concomitant medications included cinnamomum verum (CINNAMON TABLETS), quercetin, rhodiola rosea (RHODIOLA), and st johns (as reported). On 02Mar202 01:30, within 1 minute after vaccination, patient experienced all joints in arm began to sting. and was extremely nauseous, sweaty, light-headed, and unable to think clearly- very much like experiencing a sudden down in blood sugar. The doctor had patient to drink water and eat fruit. Patient reported it took about 15 minutes to be able to think clearly and was foggy headed for at least 24 hours. On 03Mar2021, (the after) patient experienced burning pain in joints of the vaccinated arm, extreme tiredness, and mild dizzy spells. On 05Mar2021, 3 days (yesterday) after vaccination, had pain in right boob and patient think maybe it was swollen as well as aching in upper right arm. Patient reported it still hurts today. Patient not tested COVID post vaccination. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood glucose: high. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of extremely nauseous, sweaty, light-headed, and unable to think clearly- very much like experiencing a sudden down in blood sugar with water and fruit. The outcome of the events reported as recovered with sequelae (Recovered with lasting effects). No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

3 days after getting 1 dose of Pfizer vaccine I started I had pain in my left arm and was losing feeling from the injection site into my fingers--tingly feeling. Joint pain in both hands--this subsided about 10 days afterwards. 13 days afterwards, my abdomen swelled--normal waist is 27--went up to 30/31 inches. 15 days afterwards (today) ankles swollen and tingly in both feet but the left worse than the right. Period is also 10 days late as of today--I was regular before the vaccine.
40 2021-06-07 infrequent menstrual cycles Symptoms are ongoing 8+ weeks post vaccine. I have had two doctors visits and numerous blood tests. ... Read more
Close
Symptoms are ongoing 8+ weeks post vaccine. I have had two doctors visits and numerous blood tests. All normal. I was perfectly healthy prior to this other than a vitamin D deficiency that is now within the normal range. No known prior COVID exposure/infection. Have been maintaining a small, strict family bubble since March 2020 - working from home, home schooling my son, no travel or even going into stores. I had the normal/expected next day reaction to the 2nd shot - extreme fatigue, body aches, headache. I rested for the full day on Saturday and felt better /normal by Sunday morning. However, by late Sunday afternoon, new symptoms came on. They started out on the left side of my body and then grew from there in the days that followed. First it was pain behind my left knee that radiated down to my ankle and later upward through my left thigh, hip, entire arm, and shoulder. From there, it progressed to all over pain in my joints on both side of my body and almost daily headaches - typically around the base of my skull. I am also experiencing prolonged periods (days and sometime weeks at a time) of constant muscle tension/soreness in both arms and legs and intermittent tightness in my chest. However, the pain has remained most intense/pronounced/persistent on my left side and a couple of different times in the last 8 weeks I've had bruising on my left foot and ankle. As a result of all of this, I am fatigued most days and it is all inhibiting my ability to function normally. I don't know whether it is related to the vaccine or not, but I know it isn't normal. My quality of life and ability to function as I typically have has decreased dramatically in the last 8 weeks and I am very worried and I don't know what to do. If someone can please contact me and advise whether they have received any similar reports and provided direction on some type of specialist or test that might be able to help, I would be forever grateful as I am scared and my primary care physician has basically just said I need to wait it out.

40 2021-06-14 infrequent menstrual cycles This isn?t really an adverse event for me, because I?m not trying to conceive, but it could be consi... Read more
Close
This isn?t really an adverse event for me, because I?m not trying to conceive, but it could be considered adverse for someone who is. It seems that both getting Covid in my last menstrual cycle AND getting the vaccines during my current menstrual cycle have caused really long cycles for me. My cycle is typically about 30 days long and quite regular. However, during my last cycle I had contracted Covid and the cycle length ended up being about 41 days. And my current cycle is on day 56 and counting. I just thought this was interesting to note, since my cycles are usually quite regular, and the only thing I can think of that has been different for me THIS cycle is that I got 2 Covid shots. I have had a tubal ligation, so it is highly unlikely that pregnancy is the reason for this unusually long menstrual cycle. Just thought this was interesting to note and important to report. Thanks!

40 2021-07-12 menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding My period has been regular for years and light for my entire life. I was due to start my menstrual c... Read more
Close
My period has been regular for years and light for my entire life. I was due to start my menstrual cycle on April 1 but I had a severe reaction to dose 2 of the COVID vaccine and was sick for several days so I didn't think much of it when I missed that cycle completely. Then on May 1st bleeding started and was extremely heavy. After 6 weeks I went to my women's health clinic and they ruled out other serious causes with an ultrasound scan and a biopsy. Via ultrasound they confirmed that my uterine lining was very thick, which makes sense with the inflammatory nature of this vaccine (activating immune system, etc.). I have been able to stop the bleeding by taking LoLoestrin, though it comes back quickly, even mid-month if I miss one day of the pill. I am finishing the second pill pack and after the third I will return to the women's health clinic for a follow up.

She got her period two weeks early; This is spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse. This Nurse reported similar events for 3 patients. This is the first of 3 reports, reporting for one of the colleagues. A 41-year-old female patient of unspecified age received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), lot number: EK5730, exp: 31Mar2021, via an unspecified route of administration on 31Dec2020 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. She was ANA and double strand is positive for autoimmune but it is watch and see thing. Patient's other medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient is not pregnant at the time of reporting. Reporter was wondering if other people were also reporting if they got their periods early. She got her period two weeks early (on 02Jan2021) and mentioned she also has two colleagues who had that as well on an unspecified date. The outcome of the event was reported as not recovered. Information on the lot/batch number has been obtained.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021004161 same reporter/drug/AE, different patient;US-PFIZER INC-2021004222 same reporter/drug/AE, different patient

Close
menstrual cycle started 4 days early with heavier than usual flow; Myalgias; Chills; Tmax 100.7; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician reported for herself. A 41-year-old female patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot: EL0142), intramuscular in the right arm on 08Jan2021, 15:00 at a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was not reported. The patient did not have Covid prior to vaccination. Patient did not have other vaccine in four weeks. Concomitant medications included multivitamin. The patient previously took amoxicillin and experienced hypersensitivity (reported as known allergies to amoxicillin). The patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (lot:EK5730), intramuscularly in the right arm on 18Dec2020 at 11:00AM at a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient experienced myalgias, chills, tmax 100.7 on 09Jan2021 09:00. It was also reported that patient's menstrual cycle started 4 days early with heavier than usual flow on 09Jan2021 11:00. Patient did not received treatment for the events. The outcome of the event myalgia, chills and pyrexia, was recovered on 09Jan2021, 21:00 and recovered on an unknown date for the event menstrual cycle abnormal. Patient was not tested positive for Covid-19 post vaccination.

41 2021-03-15 menstrual disorder, breast tenderness Within an hour of receving the vaccine, I became dizzy, had face tingling and arm tingling and felt ... Read more
Close
Within an hour of receving the vaccine, I became dizzy, had face tingling and arm tingling and felt mentally foggy. As the day progressed, I felt a fullness in my throat and fatigue. Over the next week, the dizziness became worse, I experienced intense headaches and shortness of breath for several days. I had difficulty sleeping and vivid dreams. I have had thyroiditis twice in my life after giving birth to my 2 children with similar dizziness and throat fullness. I decided to contact my doctors and had my thyroid levels checked. My TSH was abnormal and my doctor thinks I could be having another episode of thyroiditis. My menstrual cycle arrived a week early. Following this, I continued to have dizziness, throat fullness, and intense headaches. I developed sore breasts and breast discharge as well as in increase in frequency of urination. I decided to postpone the second shot until I was feeling better as past episodes of thryoiditis took about 2 months to resolve. My next menstrual period was a week late, also accompanied by mood swings, breast tenderness and intense headaches. SIx weeks later, I continue to experience occasional dizziness and throat fullness and increased urination. Prior to the vaccine, I was feeling fine and it seems like the vaccine triggered some kind of hormone/endocrine response in my body. I have not had reactions to any vaccines prior to this. I am quite hesitant to receive the second vaccine and am wondering if I should wait a period of time and try something different such as the Johnson and Johnson one. I? not quite sure what in the Pfizer vaccine ( perhaps the mRNA?) could have triggered this reaction in my thyroid and endocrine system. and would appreciate guidance on what to do next as I would like to be fully protected from COVID-19 but do not want to endure these unusual side effects.

Since my first vaccine, my menstrual cycle has been out of sync and still out of sync with my second dose vaccine. It is very concerning to me since I am planning for embryo in the future.

I am actually starting a week and a half earlier for my menstrual cycle and this really concerns me since I am planning for embryo in the future.

Close
Menorrhagia. I had a 5-day-long period that started 3/6, 2 days after my second dose of Pfizer. Then another 10-day long period started 3/19, meaning the menstrual cycle starting 3/6 was only 13 days long. I'm seeing a reproductive endocrinologist for infertility and he mentioned that a few of his patients had also seen irregular cycles after the second dose, so that's why I thought to report it here. While irregular menstrual cycles may not be a big deal to many women, I'm pursuing infertility treatment at the age of 41 and don't have time to mess up my cycles.

hemorraging; Period was late; nausea; fatigue; headaches; irregular period; Erythema multiforme major; I broke out with multiple sores all over the left Breast; a strange Blister was on my left breast; Pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 41-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 08Mar2021 10:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EP6955) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient has no medical history. Concomitant medication(s) included alprazolam (XANAX). On 08Mar2021 21:00, the patient became sick 11 hours after first dose and was ill for two days took a full week for nausea and fatigue and headaches to improve. On March 19th my period was late and by the 22nd when it started I had to be hospitalized for hemorraging and a strange Blister was on my left breast over the next two weeks I broke out with multiple sores all over the left Breast and still am and was diagnosed with Erythema multiforme major from an autoimmune response to the vaccine. Multiple ER and urgent care visits resulted as I was first misdiagnosed with Shingles. Then, I started bleeding again only 14 days after my period ended again. The pain and bleeding are as intense. I have never had irregular period in my life until the vax. The patient was hospitalized for hemorraging from 22Mar2021 to an unknown date for 1 days. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test: negative on 31Mar2021 covid test type post vaccination=Nasal Swab, covid Test name post vaccination=Pi xel by lab, covid test date=31Mar2021, covid test result=Negative. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The outcome of the events hemorraging, Erythema multiforme major, I broke out with multiple sores all over the left Breast, a strange Blister was on my left breast was not recovered, while recovering for the events nausea, fatigue, and headache, and unknown for the rest of the events. The patient second shot on March 29th and the skin lesions and sores continue to appear as well as fatigue, headache and joint pain. I was in good health before receiving the vaccine and never had skin issues or irregular or painful periods with this much bleeding.

Received 1st dose of COVID vaccine while pregnant on 3/19/21. Subsequently had an uncomplicated vaginal delivery on 3/30/21. Received 2nd dose of COVID vaccine while postpartum on 4/2/21. miscarriage; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 41-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration on 15Apr2021 16:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW1058) as 2nd dose, single or covid-19 immunisation. The first dose was received on 15Mar2021 17:00 (lot number: ENLe208). The patient's medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications were none. No other vaccine was administered in 4 weeks. Six days after receiving the 2nd shot of the Covid vaccine from Pfizer, patient conceived on 21Apr2021. After 4 weeks and 4 days of pregnancy, patient had a miscarriage on 08May2021 14:30. While a miscarriage can happen at the early stages of pregnancy, this stage was exactly when the placenta was forming and patient was wondering that the rumors about the COVID vaccine rejecting the protein of the placenta were correct. No treatment was given. Outcome of the event was not recovered. Patient did not have covid prior to vaccination and had not been tested post-vaccination.

experience breakthrough menstrual bleeding; continued taking birth control regularly but was still experiencing bleeding 3 days later; experienced migraine headaches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 41-years-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm right on 23Mar2021 13:30 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation; ethinylestradiol, norgestimate (TRI-SPRINTEC), route of administration, start and stop date, batch/lot number and dose were not reported to regulate menstrual cycle. Age at vaccination: 41 Years. The patient medical history was not reported. None known allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient regulated her menstrual cycle with birth control pills. She was currently taking ethinylestradiol, norgestimate. At the time of her first vaccine appointment the patient was taking the first week of a new pack. The patient experienced migraine headaches 48 hours after her vaccine appointment. Five days after her vaccine the patient began to experience breakthrough menstrual bleeding. The patient had continued taking birth control regularly but was still experiencing bleeding 3 days later. The bleeding was light, not heavy like a normal period, but appeared dark and viscous. No treatment was received for the adverse event. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Action taken of ethinylestradiol, norgestimate was unknown. Outcome of the event was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

41 2021-06-14 breast tenderness possible breast cancer; strong systemic reaction; throat swelling; tachycardia; rash; Repeated right... Read more
Close
possible breast cancer; strong systemic reaction; throat swelling; tachycardia; rash; Repeated right breast ultrasound May 2021 due to pain and area felt larger and more tender.; Repeated right breast ultrasound May 2021 due to pain and area felt larger and more tender.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other HCP (Nurse, patient). A 41-year-old female patient received 2nd dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, LOT number: EJ1685, expiration date unknown) via an unspecified route of administration in the arm left on an unspecified date (reported as 18Dec2020 11:00 AM and pending clarification) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Patient was not pregnant at time of vaccination. Medical history included depression, anxiety, COVID-19. Patient had drug allergies to morphine and doxycycline. Patient previously received 1st dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, LOT number: EJ1685, expiration date unknown) via an unspecified route of administration in arm right on 18Dec2020 at 11:00 AM (as reported) at age of 41-year-old at 0.3 ml, single dose for COVID-19 immunization and had strong systemic reaction. The patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Patient had usual regimen (unspecified) within 2 weeks of vaccination. It was reported that patient had strong systemic reaction with both doses. 2nd injection was sent straight from the employee health to Emergency Room due to throat swelling, tachycardia and rash. The most concerning was the area under her right Axilla found about 5 months ago. It's was originally a small bean size area. Patient had seen her primary care physician and she could felt it so got a mammogram and breast ultrasound and the radiologist did see and confirm area but felt it was related to her recent COVID 19 vaccine. There was no family history breast issues. Patient had repeated right breast ultrasound in May2021 due to pain and area felt larger and more tender. Patient had an additional area of concern moving her to BARDS 3 concerning for possible breast cancer. Patient would repeat ultrasound in 1 month so Jun2021. Patient had never had any issues and had no family history. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. Patient had emergency room visit and multiple PCP as treatment for the events. Seriousness criteria of the events was reported as disability or permanent damage. Outcome of the events was not recovered. Prior to vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient hasn't been tested for COVID-19.; Sender's Comments: Based from temporal occurrence of events and vaccination schedule, the causal association of reported events in relation to suspected drug BNT162B2 cannot be totally excluded The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate

I got my 2nd Pfizer vaccination on 3/20/21 and had a positive pregnancy test on 3/21/21. Estimated due date of 11/25/21. The bleeding continued and I went to see Dr. on Friday 4/9/21 and an ultrasound was performed where an embryo was seen with a slow heartbeat. The bleeding increased and I went back to the ER on Saturday, where they took my HCG and it had not doubled. It went up by a few points only. By Sunday, I was bleeding heavily and cramping. Monday, I went back to my OBGYN where they conducted an ultrasound to determine that I had miscarried.

Close
After the first vaccination shot (late April 2021), my menstrual cycle was fourteen days early. After the second vaccination shot, my menstrual cycle was later than usual, arriving at about Day 31 of my cycle. My cycle is typically 26 days long. The menstruation after my second shot was exceedingly heavy and painful - I had terrible cramps, worse than normal fatigue, and very heavy bleeding. The menstruation lasted longer than normal for me (about eight days), and it was followed by a few days of spotting, which is also unusual for me. In addition to these changes in my cycle, I experienced worse than normal migraines throughout the month of June, both during menstruation and during ovulation. I typically get migraines about once or twice a month, and I was getting migraines about 3-4 times a week throughout June.

Miscarriage; Heart stopped on pregnancy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 42-year-old female patient received her second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number and expiry date were not reported), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 26Feb2021 06:00 PM at a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was not reported. The patient had no known allergies. The patient was 8 weeks pregnant at the onset of the event. Last menstrual date was on 01Jan2021. There were no concomitant medications in two weeks and no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient previously received her first dose of BNT162B2 on an unspecified date at 06:00 PM in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had not been diagnosed with COVID prior to vaccination. The patient experienced miscarriage and heart stopped on pregnancy on 02Mar2021 03:00 PM. Treatment was unknown. Event resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient was due to deliver on an unknown date. The patient underwent Covid PCR test post vaccination on 04Mar2021, pending results. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information on lot/ batch has been requested.

Close
breakthrough bleeding period-wise/this has happened through years; breakthrough bleeding period-wise/this has happened through years; sore arm; extreme fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient herself). A 42-year-old female patient, not pregnant, received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN6198) via an unspecified route of administration administered on the left arm, on 23Feb2021 09:45, at a single dose, for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included breakthrough bleeding at times through years. There were no known allergies. Concomitant medication included hydromorphone hydrochloride (DILAUDID) and, alprazolam (XANAX) - both taken for unspecified indications, start and stop dates were not reported. Also as reported concomitant medications included "oxymoron" and "flexibility". The patient did not have Covid prior vaccination. The patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks. The patient stated it was weird because she experienced a breakthrough bleeding period-wise 12 days after shot, on 07Mar2021 11:00. She stated this has happened through years and; a bunch of women on (social site name) were discussing it and majority had a breakthrough bleeding 1-2 weeks after shot and; that they will also be reporting. The patient stated she has no idea if this was a true side effect, but she considered it strange that so many experienced it too. She also experienced normal sore arm and extreme fatigue - both on 07Mar2021 11:00. Her next dose will be tomorrow, 16Mar2021. The patient recovered from the adverse events on Mar2021 with no treatment received. The patient was not Covid-tested post-vaccination.

Irregular menstruation after 2nd dose/The following day after I received the 2nd shot I started to bleed heavily; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (Patient). A 42-year-old female patient (non-pregnant) received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number EN6200 and expiration date not provided) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 24Mar2021 02:00 PM as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history was not provided. The patient's historical vaccine included first dose of BNT162B2 (Solution for injection, lot number EN6203 and expiration date not provided) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm as SINGLE DOSE on 03Mar2021 2:00 PM for COVID-19 immunization. There were no allergies to medications, food, or other products. No known allergies. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 25 Mar 2021, the patient had irregular menstruation after 2nd dose and it was reported that, following day after the patient received the 2nd shot and she started to bleed heavily. Heavy bleeding consisted for 5 days. On the 6th day it stopped. The patient assessed the events as non-serious.cThe adverse event resulted in emergency room. No treatment was received in response to the adverse events. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, patient was not tested for COVID-19. On 31 Mar2021, the event was resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

42 2021-04-21 heavy menstrual bleeding About two hours after the vaccine, I started bleeding that appeared to be the onset of a period. I t... Read more
Close
About two hours after the vaccine, I started bleeding that appeared to be the onset of a period. I thought this was a one off case of spotting - albeit a substantial amount of blood - however I went on to have a period that was very heavy and lasted 7 days. This was alarming as I have not had a period since June 25, 2020 and was diagnosed as Perimenopausal in Dec 2020 with a FSH levels of 96.3 and TSH level of 2.27 and LH level of 74.8 I have not had any spotting or periods at all since June 25, 2020. The period that I had from 3/22/2021-3/28/21 was not painful (which is abnormal for me) and was extremely heavy ever day - which is also uncommon for me. Since then I have had my second shot on 4/12 and have not experienced any adverse effects nor another period.

Close
With the first Pfizer dose on 02/16/21, I experienced immediate pain at the injection site. This pain increased and became increasingly severe and extremely intense within 5 hours of the vaccine. At that time other symptoms began to develop, including a very severe headache (crown/back of head), swollen glands and stiff neck, rapid heartrate, shortness of breath. These symptoms lasted at an intense level for 2 days, and at a moderate level for a total of 14 days (last symptoms were observed on 02/23/2021). Please also note that I started my period that month on 02/17/2021. My second Pfizer dose was on 03/9/2021, 1:40pm. (COVID19 Pfizer~BioNTech, Lot EN6205, intramuscular, left arm). I experienced mild pain at the injection site within 5 hours of the vaccine. 24 hours after the second dose I began to develop moderate/severe symptoms including headache (crown/back of head), swollen glands and stiff neck, rapid heartrate, shortness of breath. These symptoms lasted at a moderate level for a total of 14 days (last symptoms were observed on 03/23/2021. Please note that I started my period that month on 03/17/2021. This month I started my period 2 days later than usual on 04/14/2021. In addition to my regular menstrual symptoms (including migraine temporal headache and mild cramps), I experienced additional symptoms starting on 04/15/2021. These included moderate/severe headache (crown/back of head), swollen glands and stiff neck, rapid heartrate, and shortness of breath. These symptoms are still present at a moderate level today, 04/22/2021.

42 2021-04-27 heavy menstrual bleeding Heavy Periods two and half weeks apart. 1st one was very heavy and second one has been five days of ... Read more
Close
Heavy Periods two and half weeks apart. 1st one was very heavy and second one has been five days of painful cramping so far. Very unusual for my cycle. Also had flu like symptoms the day after my second shot for about 24 hours, but I was expecting that. I was not expecting issues with menstruation. I have heard antidotal stories from other women that they experienced heavy and painful menstruation after the shot. Women really should be told this is a side effect if it is so they don't think something is "wrong" and so that they can be prepared.

Close
I have an IUD and have not had a menstrual cycle in over four years. That said, I do 'spot' when my body is fighting something. The morning following shot two, I spotted. My other symptoms were general fatigue and just a 'bleh' feeling. This morning, four weeks and four days after the spotting incident, I spotted again. I have no symptoms and feel 100% ok. Nothing alarming, just unusual for my body. Wasn't sure how deep the reporting was going, so thought I would share.

Close
red splotches on her arm and a little on her face/Arm was very splotchy; Also got kind of hot/Face a little hot; anemic; she thought she was getting shorter; second period which was pretty heavy; had her period twice in a month; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 42-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EP7533 and expiration date not provided), via an unspecified route of administration, in arm right, on an unspecified date (at the age of 42-year-old), at single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included allergy to steroid (patient did not remember the name of the steroid. Patient was given to her to stop from pre term labor when she had her last child. when patient took it, her heart pounds, almost like cardiac arrest. Was told to never do the steroid ever again); ongoing latex allergy; and allergic reaction to soap. No prior vaccination within 4 weeks. No family medical history. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took ibuprofen (MOTRIN) for back pain (It was usually around her period or if her back was injured. Patient had injured back so many times. It was not used as an everyday thing). Patient stated her period was usually normal. And patient had her period twice in a month. Patient was started a second period which was pretty heavy, was anemic, so was a little concerned. On 18Apr2021, the patient had heavy second period. It was started last night at dinner, was very unexpected. And it was still very heavy, like in the middle of patient's period. Patient had been taking MOTRIN, which she usually took for back pain. About a half hour after the shot, patient's face a little hot. Half hour after the shot. Patient's left arm was very splotchy/ red splotches in left arm and a little on her face, also got kind of hot. Patient thought it must be from the body wash. Patient never noticed that before. Patient had allergic reaction to soap before and it was usually immediate. Is possible to be from the body wash. The splotches had gone away. It was ended the night she got home, same day as the shot. No emergency room or physician's office required. Patient's height was 5'3" and stated that she thought she was getting shorter. The outcome of the events "had her period twice in a month" was not recovered; of event "red splotches on her arm and a little on her face/Arm was very splotchy", "Also got kind of hot/Face a little hot" was recovered in 2021; of other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

42 2021-05-09 menstruation irregular 6 hours post-shot I briefly had a sharp headache & intense fatigue, but came & went in just about ha... Read more
Close
6 hours post-shot I briefly had a sharp headache & intense fatigue, but came & went in just about half an hour. Exactly 12 hours after my second Pfizer covid vaccine shot, I woke up at 2:25am shaking with cold for approx. 2 hours: no fever, but couldn't stop shaking or feeling freezing even after putting on two thick sweaters & four wool/down blankets. Followed by intense piercing/pressurized headache coming in waves for about the next 10 hours. At the 24-hour mark post-shot, I felt 100% better. However the same intense shaking/cold (without a fever) came back again at 30 hours post-shot and lasted another 2hrs (example of the intense shaking: my hand was shaking so hard I couldn't hold a spoon to eat soup). Felt better with a burst of energy after that which caused insomnia for a few hours (9:30pm-1:30am). Headache never returned. No arm pain until 12 hours post-shot and is still pretty painful 54 hours later. Finally, I didn't believe the anecdotal reports about the vaccine affecting menstrual cycles, but do want to mention that 48 hours post-shot my period arrived five days early; that has only happened to me once in my life (7 years ago), so I do wonder if it's connected to the "shock" the vaccine apparently gave my body (as evidenced by the cold/shaking/headache experience).

Menstrual cramps and fatigue. I have had an IUD for nearly 10 years, so I do not have periods at all, nor do I have cramps. It was bad enough that I took ibuprofen, which I avoid and only take about once a year. Cramps subsided by the next day.
42 2021-05-12 menstrual disorder I received the injection and was told to wait for 15 minutes. Shortly after receiving the shot, I ha... Read more
Close
I received the injection and was told to wait for 15 minutes. Shortly after receiving the shot, I had to use the restroom, so I asked if it was ok to do that before I sat for the 15 minutes. As I was walking to the bathroom, I felt a warm tingling sensation go through my arms (almost as if I could feel the injection going through my veins) and then the sensation traveled down my legs and my heart started RACING. This all happened within two to three minutes after receiving the shot. At first I just thought it was odd, but as I kept walking my heart rate continued to skyrocket and I did not like the way I felt. I went to the EMTs and they laid me down and hooked me up to a blood pressure machine. My blood pressure was significantly elevated (which is very unusual for me). As someone with neurocardiogenic syncope, my blood pressure typically drops - the way I felt was not at all in line with a syncopal episode. My heart rate remained elevated while at rest, but did come down a little bit after about 20 minutes; my blood pressure would also come down a bit while at rest but as I would lift my head (even just a little bit) to drink something my blood pressure and heart rate would again sky rocket. This went on for 1.5 hours. After about 2 hours, I was finally able to sit up without my blood pressure and heart rate going through the roof, but I felt simply awful. For the next two weeks I felt light headed (as if my head was detached from my body) and dizzy. I couldn't get out of bed in the morning without drinking a gatorade as I felt so weak and shaky. I developed significant heart palpitations that lasted for a solid month. Additionally, I am someone who has always gotten a period at 27-28 days. I had my regular period two days after vaccination (which was when it was due), but then I got it again 16 days later. That has never before in my life happened to me. Not during illness or times of high stress. Somehow I had a significant reaction to this vaccine and my cardiologist advised that I do not get the second.

When I received my first shot, I was on my menstrual and I noticed that the bleeding had lingered a few days longer than usual. Two weeks after, I started bleeding again. This has never happened to me before. I called my GYN Dr. and she had me take a pregnancy test (it was negative) to see if that was it or she thought maybe I could be going through early menopause. I bled for a few days and it stopped. I just received my second shot on Saturday and Sunday I started bleeding again. Here it is Thursday and I am still bleeding about a week and a half after it finally stopped the second time after getting the first shot. I do believe the shot have me bleeding like this. Has anyone else had this problem before? I have an appointment with the GYN on May 26th

bleeding; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 42-year-old not pregnant female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 06Apr2021 10:30 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8734) as UNKNOWN, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included allergies to Penicillin, turkey, chicken. Patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient had vaccine on 06Apr2021 and that evening about 22:00 started bleeding very heavy. She bled for 2 1/2 weeks changing overnight pads ever 45-60 minutes. On 21Apr21 was bleeding so bad. Changing pads every 10 minutes. Patient went to the emergency room and was gave a very heavy dose of hormones to stop the bleeding. She went to see gynaecologist on 23Apr21 and was scheduled for a hysterectomy due to all the bleeding. The event outcome was not recovered. The patient was hospitalized for bleeding (haemorrhage) for 1 day. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Nasal Swab covid test: negative on 10May2021.

Close
A week after the 1st shot my period came on extremely heavy.Gushing, passing clots and bleeding through both pad and tampon quickly!; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp (patient). A 42-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), at same age, dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 07May2021 15:00 as 1ST DOSE, SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included iron deficiency anemia, and pernicious anemia. Concomitant medications included iron; cyanocobalamin (VIT B12); ascorbic acid, biotin, calcium pantothenate, calcium phosphate dibasic, cyanocobalamin, ferrous fumarate, folic acid, magnesium oxide, manganese sulfate, nicotinamide, potassium sulfate, pyridoxine hydrochloride, riboflavin, thiamine mononitrate, tocopheryl acid succinate, zinc sulfate (MULTI VITAMINS & MINERALS); and ibuprofen. The patient experienced a week after the 1st shot her period came on extremely heavy, gushing, passing clots and bleeding through both pad and tampon quickly on 14May2021 16:30 with outcome of recovering. Patient had iron deficiency anemia that had been under control until now. Had not bled like this in years. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. No treatment was received. Information about batch/Lot number has been requested.

Close
Fever; Back pain; Sick; like the flu, a bad flu; could not get up; body looked like somebody hit her, like she had a crash , had body pain; body was very heavy; She now has her period.; This is spontaneous report from a Pfizer sponsored program. A contactable consumer reported that a 42-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine, Solution for Injection, Batch/lot number: ER8729, Expiration date: Unknown), via an unspecified route on right shoulder on 13Apr2021 at around 16:00, as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine, Solution for Injection, LOT: ER8727, Expiration date: Unknown) on 23Mar2021 at around 16:00, on right shoulder, as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Family history included diabetes (mother) and high cholesterol (husband) and prostate cancer (Father-in-law). She received the vaccine at like 2:00pm or 3:00pm. Initially reported as around 2:00 or 3:00pm; but when time of administration later queried reported she thinks they were both at the same time, like 3:00 or 4:00pm, thinks it was around 4:00pm By 9:00pm that day, her body looked like somebody hit her, like she had a crash on 13Apr2021. After the vaccine, she was sick for one day on 13Apr2021. She had a fever, and was like the flu, a bad flu on 14Apr2021 and she could not get up on 13Apr2021. Was like fever, body pain, and couldn't get up, she was very sick. After 24 hours, it was like nothing happened. On 13Apr2021, the back pain was a lot and on an unspecified date in 2021, her body was very heavy but had no headaches. She preferred being in bed. She had a fever at night, like at midnight. She didn't take any medicine. The next day, around 3:00pm, she took Tylenol and at about 7:00pm, it was like nothing happened, like she didn't receive the shot. It was very crazy. Like 24 hours after, she didn't feel anything. She thinks this was normal. The fever started in the middle of the night, around midnight, 3:00am. She does not remember she was in bed. The fever came and would go out and would come and go again. Was only for one night. On an unspecified date in 2021, She now has her period. The clinical outcome of the event was didn't feel anything after 24 hours (13Apr2021) and thinks this is normal, at about 19:00 on 14Apr2021 it was like nothing happened, like she didn't receive the shot, fever, she was sick, like the flu, a bad flu, body looked like somebody hit her, like she had a crash, had body pain was recovered on 14Apr2021 and events back pain, couldn't get up, body was very heavy, She now has her period was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Apart from this most serious side effect, also experienced fainting and headaches as well as a discontinuance of my menstrual cycle during the initial injection. Subsequently a much shorter cycle the second one after injection of said vaccine.

42 2021-07-01 menstrual disorder I got the Pfizer COVID vaccine (1st shot on 4/26/21 and 2nd shot on 5/17/21). I have always had regu... Read more
Close
I got the Pfizer COVID vaccine (1st shot on 4/26/21 and 2nd shot on 5/17/21). I have always had regular periods and when I got my period on 5/16, this was the first time I had it since I took the first dose of the vaccine. I noticed a change in the bleeding pattern. I typically use 4-5 maxi pads/ day on the 1st and 2nd day of my period but this time, I only had spotting on the first day that a liner was adequate for and on the second day (5/17) I used the smallest pad. The bleeding increased on days 3 & 4 for which I used a small pad but overall the amount of bleeding was significantly less than normal. I also noticed a small nodule under the skin on my lower back. It doesn't hurt and you can't see it from the outside but I can feel it if I run my fingers over my back. My next period was on 6/13 and bleeding was light on day 1 but more than what I had in May. Bleeding increased on days 2 & 3 and ultimately tapered off but over all, I just used small pads as opposed to a maxi pad the entire time. The nodule is still present and has not changed in size. I plan to continue to monitor my cycle.

Close
I found out in May22nd that I had a positive pregnancy test - five weeks pregnant - 10 days later - symptoms subsided. June 7th - Ultrasound - dated at 5/1/2 weeks and I went back 8 days later - showed pregnancy was nonviable at that point. My miscarriage symptoms on the 17th. The miscarriage was pretty much completed that day and then I bled five or six days. No complications. I didn't need any follow up care. I had miscarriage three and half years ago and there were complications for that. I met with my midwife a few days afterwards here now but they didn't do an examination or blood draw. Pregnancy history - 13th pregnancy - 6 miscarriages and 7 live births. Estimated date of delivery - January 22, 2022
42 2021-07-08 menstruation irregular (On Tuesday, June 29th) Within the first 5 minutes, my left side and tongue went numb, I felt very l... Read more
Close
(On Tuesday, June 29th) Within the first 5 minutes, my left side and tongue went numb, I felt very lightheaded and vision faded and felt like I was going to faint. This lasted 20 minutes. I waited 40 minutes to be sure that I was okay. For the next 3 days, my joints were stiff, did not have any energy, and slept a lot. I did not get my period as scheduled, and it still has not come- am NOT pregnant. I had a hard time recalling words, had constant headache, and lost my smell again (had covid in December, and did not get my smell back until May). I felt like an old elderly woman. I did not have any fever, body aches, or much pain in the injection site. It felt just like Covid again, except without the fever and body aches. On Friday, I was back to normal.
