sore arm; Extreme fatigue; My arms felt like lead for three days; I felt so sleepy/I felt like I could barely keep my eyes open for three days; mild headache; menstrual cramps; diarrhea; I had bizarre dreams like being attacked by zombies for three days; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 43-year-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EJ1686), via an unspecified route of administration at Left arm on 23Dec2020 17:45 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Patient known allergies included Imitrex, beef, grass, weeds, trees, Cats. Other medical history included Asthma, allergies, migraine, Premenstrual syndrome (PMS), overweight. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine but received other medications in two weeks. The COVID-19 vaccine was administered at Hospital. The patient experienced extreme fatigue. Her arms felt like lead for three days, and she felt so sleepy. She felt like she could barely keep her eyes open for three days. She had a mild headache. It triggered menstrual cramps and diarrhea for three days. She had bizarre dreams like being attacked by zombies for three days. She had chills for a few hours. She had a sore arm for a couple of days. Adverse events start date was 23Dec2020 10:00 PM. Treatment included Tylenol. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 and since the vaccination, the patient was not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of chills was recovered on 24Dec2020, of headache, chills, fatigue and sore arm was recovered in Dec2020, of other events was recovered on 26Dec2020.

I don't know if it is a coincidence or related to the COVID vaccine but figured I should report it. I am still spotting and suspect I will until I have my actual period with this pill pack.

I was approximately 4 weeks pregnant at the time that I received dose #1 (12/23/20)- I was unaware of the pregnancy. I was diagnosed with COVID on 12/28/20, but was first symptomatic on 12/24. I attributed my s/s initially to the vaccine. I was eventually tested on 12/28/20, as my symptoms worsened and I was positive for COVID. On 1/14/21 I received my second dose, my COVID s/s had been resolved since 1/4/21. On the evening of 1/18/21 I started experiencing mild abdominal pain. This progressed, on the evening 1/20 the pain was no longer tolerable. I went to the ER where I hemorrhaged and needed emergency surgery and a blood transfusion for a miscarriage. The surgery ultimately took place in the early morning hours of 1/22/21, followed by the blood transfusion.

I decided to go to bed since I wasn't feeling well. I woke at 2:00am with contractions and heavy bleeding. I went to the ED at 3:00am on 1/30 to confirm my miscarriage. For 4 days following the injection I experienced tiredness, intermittent nausea, and tenderness to both breasts. I woke from sleep dry heaving multiple times. On the 4th day after injection, it was severe enough that I took a pregnancy test because they symptoms matched that. It was negative. The following, or 5th day, all the symptoms stopped.
43 2021-02-17 heavy menstrual bleeding, vaginal haemorrhage I didn?t notice any symptoms right away. When they started, I didn?t think it was abnormal at first... Read more
Close
I didn?t notice any symptoms right away. When they started, I didn?t think it was abnormal at first. I am female and still have my menstrual cycle. This time it appeared to be heavier than usual and had some blood clots. However, before I was on birth control it was always that way. Sometimes it is a little heavier when I have more stress or the weather is not ideal. My cycle started around 2/4/21. On 2/8/21, I combed my one cat. She scratched and bit me and has done so in the past. She and I both are vaccinated and I?ve never developed any infections because of it in the past. On 2/10/21, I noticed a cluster of red pinpoint dots underneath my skin on my arms and chest. They weren?t bumpy, warm to the touch, itchy or anything. It just looked odd and I didn?t know how it happened. I work with a Nurse Practitioner and she suggested I go into to a clinic as those usually indicate an infection is developing. I went to the Urgent Care and was treated. He did blood work on me and informed me that my glucose was a little low. It was suppertime so that didn?t surprise me. He told me there was no signs of infection in my blood work but was prescribing two antibiotics in case one developed. When I was getting my meds at the pharmacy, a call was coming through that I didn?t recognize so do to phone scams, I didn?t answer it. I started the antibiotics. Then over the course of 2/13/21 and 2/14/21 weekend days, I felt more fatigued than usual, nauseated, had a decreased appetite and still had my menstrual cycle. I still didn?t think much about it as a side effect of the antibiotics was nausea and decreased appetite and the fatigue could be related to it being so cold and winter usually affects my depression symptoms. Then on 2/14/21 I noticed my lower abdomen was covered in those red, pinpoint blood dot clusters and there were unexplained bruises on my body. I took a shower and when I went to wash my legs, my pelvic area was completely bloody and a blood clot dropped into the bathtub. Never has that occurred when I have my period. It looked like I had just given birth it was so much blood. I became nauseated and dry heaved several times. On 2/15/21, I sent a message to Dr asking what was happening to me. He called me and informed me that he had tried to call me the night he saw me because he saw my platelet count was only 11,000 and should be a minimum of 140,000. Dr asked that I return to Urgent Care as soon as possible. I arrived there around 12:30 pm that day. He had bloodwork done again on me. My platelets went down to 9,000. I explained that my menstrual cycle would not stop and it should?ve but I just keep bleeding. Dr contacted a Hematologist that informed him that recently the blood disorder Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP) has been linked with the COVID19 vaccination in rare cases. I was scheduled to be seen by a Hematologist and put on the medication prednisone to build up my platelet count. I returned to Urgent Care for blood work again on 2/16/21. My platelets went up to 30,000. I met with Hematology on 2/17/21 and had blood work again, platelets 28,000. All providers looked over my medical record and noted that since my gastric bypass surgery in 2015, my health has been good, my blood work has been normal and I live a clean lifestyle. Again, the only issue showing up in my bloodwork was that my platelets were extremely low. Now I have weekly blood draws, take 80 mg of prednisone and have a Hematologist when just a few weeks ago my health was good.

On 2/20/21 when I woke up I went to use the restroom. When I wiped I noticed that I was spotting on the tissue. This happened a second time and then it was finished. I felt really tired and not myself. Then later that night my arm began to hurt so bad that I could not lift it. I began to rub the area that was hurting and noticed that I now had a nice size lump there . I took a Tylenol 500mg and a hot shower. When I woke up the next morning my arm was still hurting but not as bad. When I went to use the bathroom I had began to start spotting again. This continued throughout the day and now I am bleeding as if I was having my period. I am super tired. It is to the point that i cant function at work.
43 2021-02-22 menstruation delayed numbness of face; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; ... Read more
Close
numbness of face; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; swelling and itching of tongue and lips; menstral cycle thrown off by 10 days; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 43-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (COVID 19, Pfizer, Solution for injection, Lot number: not available/provided to reporter at the time of report completion), intramuscular, Left arm on 06Jan2021 13:45 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Age at vaccination was 43 years. Patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Medical history included Hoshimotos and Acid reflux. Allergies to medications, food, or other products included sulfa allergy. The patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications received within 2 weeks of vaccination included omeprazole 40mg, paroxetine 20mg. On 06Jan2021 14:00, the patient experienced swelling and itching of tongue and lips within 15 min, numbness of face the next day (on 07Jan2021) continuing for several weeks. Menstral cycle thrown off by 10 days. The events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. Recovered with lasting effects. Benadryl, pepcid and prednisone treatment was received for the events. Events outcome was recovered with sequelae. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the strong temporal relationship, the association between the vaccine and the events swollen tongue, lip swelling, tongue pruritus, lip pruritus, hypoaesthesia cannot be completely excluded. Delayed menstruation is probably an intercurrent condition for which the patient's age is also a contributing factor. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

43 2021-03-15 pelvic pain The time prior to the vaccine, I had no pelvic pain or limitations in physical activity. 1/7/2021 ... Read more
Close
The time prior to the vaccine, I had no pelvic pain or limitations in physical activity. 1/7/2021 Received Pfizer Vaccine #1 experienced left arm soreness at the injection site. The evening of 1/7/2021 following the injection, developed dull lower pelvic pain. Pelvic pain worsened over the next two days 1/9/2021 Symptoms of pelvic pain intensified to now excruciating, sharp pain 1/10/2021 Seen at nearby urgent care and evaluated by healthcare provider; referred to nearby emergency department for further evaluation, work up and recommended imaging. Evaluated by emergency room physician, lab work collected and imaging were completed. CT scan showed 7cm mass in the right pelvis, small amount of pelvic fluid. Pelvic ultrasound was also completed and confirmed 7 cm round lesion in the right adnexa. Discharged home with pain medication and instructions for outpatient follow up. 1/12/2021 Seen by PCP and referral sent OB/GYN; Symptoms are now as dull pelvic pain, associated with rectal pressure and a pelvic pulling sensation position dependent, also associated with intense internal rectal pain at the time of bowel movements and weight loss. 1/14/2021 Seen by OB/GYN, repeat pelvic ultrasound ordered 1/22/2021 Repeat pelvic ultrasound completed showed 7.4 cm right adnexal cystic lesion increased in size 1/28/2021 Received Pfizer Vaccine #2, staff at vaccination clinic informed of pelvic pain onset after Vaccine #1 injection. Approximately 4 hours after Vaccine #2, I developed severe sharp pain again similar to after Vaccine #1 which required pain medication for relief. 1/29/2021 Pain improved with medication 1/30/2021 Symptoms have now returned to dull pelvic pain, associated with rectal pressure and a pelvic pulling sensation position dependent, also associated with intense internal rectal pain at the time of bowel movements and continued weight loss until scheduled surgery 2/26/2021. 2/12/2021 Seen by PCP, cleared for surgery; labs completed 2/17/2021 Seen by OB/GYN for preoperative visit 2/23/2021 Seen at hospital for COVID Preop Testing 2/26/2021 Surgery completed under general anesthesia ? Laparoscopic myomectomy with mini-laparotomy, lysis of bowel adhesions to degenerating fibroid tumor The time prior to the vaccine, I had no pelvic pain or limitations in physical activity.

43 2021-04-12 infrequent menstrual cycles, menstrual cramps, heavy menstrual bleeding A more heavier and painful menstrual cycle that was extended for approximately 14+ days (which has n... Read more
Close
A more heavier and painful menstrual cycle that was extended for approximately 14+ days (which has never happened before). Be advised, in speaking with others, additional reports are surfacing that more and more woman are experiencing similar and additional menstrual cycle problems, including missed periods, after receiving the Covid vaccination. Pre-menopausal woman have a right to know this is a potential side effect to not only educate but eliminate fear and conspiracy theories, which would deter and hinder other woman (especially those of child bearing years) to not get vaccinated.

43 2021-04-17 pelvic pain lower pelvic pain that progressed into severe pain over the next day; pain with bowel movements; dif... Read more
Close
lower pelvic pain that progressed into severe pain over the next day; pain with bowel movements; difficulty to sit; weight loss; 4 hours after injection developed again the severe pain; pelvic mass; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Physician (for herself). A 43-years-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 28Jan2021 (Batch/Lot number was not reported), age at vaccination of 43-years-old , as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included rubber sensitivity from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing (known allergy Latex - contact) and COVID-19 infection (prior to vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19). The patient was not pregnant and was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (lot number EL1284), on 07Jan2021 12:00 PM, vaccine location Arm Left and experienced lower pelvic pain that progressed into severe pain over the next day, pain with bowel movements, difficulty to sit, weight loss, resulted in hospitalisation for one day for suspected pelvic mass. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered: Health Clinic/Administration facility. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medication included daily multivitamin. The patient received 2nd on 28Jan2021 and 4 hours after injection, she developed again the severe pain experienced after the first injection require pain management. Underwent laparoscopic surgery for removal of pelvic mass and lysis of adhesions of intestines. Prior to the 1st vaccine on 07Jan2021 I had no pelvic pain or intestinal issues, no prior surgery and had maintained a very active lifestyle. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of the event was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. Information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.; Sender's Comments: Based from known drug safety profile and temporal occurrence, the causal association of the reported events in relation to suspected drug BNT162B2 cannot be totally excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate

Unsure if related to Covid vaccination, however symptoms indicate an abrupt onset change for me so wanted them reported. After vaccination with Dose #2 of Pfizer Covid vaccine, had 1 menstrual cycle considered normal to my history. Skipped the next cycle entirely without any spotting or symptoms typical of my period presentation (No chance of pregnancy). Currently experiencing the subsequent cycle and having symptoms very abnormal to my history. Excessive and heavy bleeding, soaking through feminine products every 2-3 hours (currently in Day 3 of that symptom). I have never experienced bleeding of this extreme in my lifetime. OB/GYN aware, no treatment indicated at this time, follow up parameters have been provided by their office.

Close
Day 1: Symptoms of fatigue, malaise develop at 12pm. Symptoms of fatigue, malaise worsen, headache develops. Go right to bed after work at 4:30pm Day 2: Extreme fatigue, malaise, brain fog. Severe joint pain, immobility. Inability to go to work, bedridden. Later that evening, Redness, pain, and swelling of right eye (iritis) begin to develop, indicating beginning of lupus flare. Day 3: Iritis increase in severity, Moderate to severe aches and joint pain, moderate fatigue, malaise, brain fog. Contact rheumatologist & ophthalmologist. Prednisone therapy withheld to prevent inhibiting immune response to vaccine. Day 4-14: All symptoms persist, then dull to functional levels by Day 14. Rheumatologist recommends this flare be reported to VADERS. 3/17: Given 2 wk prednisone taper for Lupus flare that developed days earlier. (Extreme fatigue, malaise, brain fog. Severe joint pain, immobility. Close
I passed a number of large blood clots (the size of a walnut) from my body on the two days after I received the shot. The day that I got the shot coincided with the day that I got my period, so I was already menstruating when the clots passed from my body. The clots were much larger than normal, and much more frequent. I passed almost a half dozen large clots. By the third day, my menstruation flow started to subside (the first two days tend to be heavier days for me). I did not pass any large clots on the third day going forward.

Then 10 days later, I started spotting (very unusual for me) and had another menstrual cycle a few days after that. This resulted in two cycles within 21 days, which is also very unusual for me. After the second vaccination on 4/15/21, I experienced body aches and a fever within 12-36 hours from injection. I also experienced soreness in my right breast and lymph node above the breast (now 13 days post-vaccination and this has not subsided). I also had an episode of vertigo lasting 12 hours on the 10th day after the second vaccination.

The day after the vaccine I experienced brain fog, fatigue, and sore arm. I also got my period. I have a history of painful periods but after an endometrial ablation over 10 years ago I have had normal pain. The period after the vaccine was incredibly painful and the consistency of the discharge was completely different. Pale pink clots that almost looked like uterine lining instead of clots I'm used to seeing. I want to report this because I've talked to other women who've had something similar but I didn't see anything about it on the CDC website.

Two days after the dose (on the 14th) my period began suddenly three days early, which is unheard of for me. I also developed a migraine on the 14th that lasted for a total of 9 days. This is also unheard of for me.
43 2021-05-02 menstruation irregular About 20 minutes after I was vaccinated, I started feeling unwell - sore throat, ears hurting/ringin... Read more
Close
About 20 minutes after I was vaccinated, I started feeling unwell - sore throat, ears hurting/ringing, fatigue, nausea, headache. It lasted about 2.5-3 hours. After which I felt great, better than I had in a long while. The next day on Saturday, May 1, 2021, I unexpectedly started my menstrual cycle. In all my 25+ years of having my menstrual cycle, NEVER once have I been early or was in unexpected. I am very regular - 28-29 days. Typically heavy and lasts 7 days. The first day is always the roughest with cramping but after, it subsides. BUT on May 1, 2021 - my period started and I didn't even notice - it was light. I will say this though - I feel like whatever was in that vaccine actually was a good thing for my body - I don't know how, but I feel great, even 3 days later. Let's hope it lasts. (As a side note- I was never diagnosed with COVID ALTHOUGH I asked my PCP in Jan 2020 when I wasn't getting better since December 2019 if I had that coronavirus - she assured me at the time that I did not and it was not here. I was convinced myself that I had COVID in December 2019 because I had traveled. I asked her how that virus could not be here yet when we have international travel- she gave me a response but I still was not convinced. so, perhaps I did - perhaps my symptoms in 2020 were long haul covid symptoms and the vaccine helped me.

She got her vaccine, arm was sore immediately until 6:00 PM when she started getting severe menstrual cramps, but not due for her period. She thought it was weird and her ribs were burning. She went to sleep and about 24 hours the menstrual cramps went away, but the pain in the right side remained. It was burning type of ache. By Saturday she had told some family members, and told her that it sounded like appendicitis and she just watched it. Today it is a little more fainter, it is a little bit lighter. She did the patient portal this morning and she lives next to the hospital and said if it got worse she would go to the hospital. She is waiting to hear back from her doctor to see what she should do. She has not taken anything for the symptoms.

43 2021-05-17 abnormally short menstrual cycles Additional menses began 10 days after previous regular menses began
43 2021-05-18 menstrual disorder, intermenstrual bleeding A few minutes after my first injection shot, I experienced a wave of nausea, flushing, and a metalli... Read more
Close
A few minutes after my first injection shot, I experienced a wave of nausea, flushing, and a metallic taste. I waited for 30 minutes and was assured everything was stable. During the next several days, I experienced high fevers, nausea, vomiting, myalgia, and minor neuropathy (legs/feet). Over the next few weeks, I continued to have intermittent fevers, nausea, myalgia, and episodes of numbness and tingling in my hands and feet. I consulted with my PCP on 1/28 to see if I should continue with the 2nd dose and was advised to do so. After receiving the second dose, I experienced a similar reaction as the first, with high fevers, nausea, vomiting, myalgia, and minor neuropathy in my legs and feet. One new symptoms following the second dose was muscle twitching in the legs. Approximately two weeks after the second dose, I experienced acute paresthesia of both legs. It began with a bubbling sensation for two days and then progressed to an abrupt onset of burning and tingling. The muscle twitching in both legs increased and also began to appear in my arms. It is now 3 months past the second dose and I continue to have all over muscle twitching and chronic paresthesias of both legs, arms, hands, and tongue (worse in legs). I also have extreme pain in all of my fingertips, intermittent electric shock sensations in my face and mouth, and internal vibration/buzzing sensations. My POTS symptoms which I had previously managed with adequate hydration and TriOral rehydration salts (no medication) have all been exacerbated. On a side note, I also experienced two menstrual cycles in both months that I received the vaccine and continue to have spotting between periods. I do not have a history of irregular menstrual cycles or spotting. I am currently scheduled for an ultrasound and endometrial biopsy to further assess these symptoms.
43 2021-05-18 menstrual disorder Missed menstrual cycle - so far 2 Lump under left armpit
43 2021-05-19 heavy menstrual bleeding Menstrual Issues (Continued bleeding); This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable heal... Read more
Close
Menstrual Issues (Continued bleeding); This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). This 43-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration on 08Feb2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EL9264) as 2nd dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. Patient received the first dose on 13Jan2021 (Batch/lot number: EL1283). The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient is not pregnant at time of vaccination. The patient previously took a cortisone shot at the end of Dec2020. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Patient has not been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. Patient experienced menstrual issues: continued bleeding on 08Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered. Treatment was received. Event resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit.; Sender's Comments: Based on chronological connection to the vaccine a causal relationship between event "menstrual issues: continued bleeding" and BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) cannot be completely excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

She had the second dose 3 weeks after the first dose on 22Mar2021 and a couple days after that her period started early on 03May2021 and she is now on her period and on Day 16 and it's gotten worse. She had issues with both doses and enquired if prolonged bleeding with periods was a side effect of the vaccine and how long these periods last and if they ever end. She stated she knew there were other women with these things. It was really, really heavy bleeding along with clots and things. She was tested for anemia in Apr2021 and her iron was low and was found to be anemic. She went to a specialist and was suggested a biopsy to rule out that there was nothing else going on. They suggested for doing an ablation to stop the bleeding or a partial hysterectomy if nothing else worked. She did not had any energy and it was hard to breath with no oxygen in blood. This female consumer (patient) reported that a 43-years-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EWO187), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm (at the age of 43-years-old) on 28May2021 14:30 as 2nd dose, single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was not reported. Her mother has breast cancer. The patient did not have history of previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. No additional Vaccines Administered on Same Date of the Pfizer Suspect and no prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks). The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: unknown, Lot number and Expiration date: EWO173), via an unspecified route of administration in arm right on 05May2021 14:30 as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation and had no reaction on previous exposure to vaccine. The patient reported that within the last 2 weeks, she began experiencing right arm pain and right breast pain. She reports that up until last Friday morning (11Jun2021), it was tolerable, but Friday morning she experienced right breast pain and her right breast feels "heavier" and "tighter" than her left and it feels like "lumps". Her right breast feels heavier than the left one. She says that she does not take medication of any kind and that the covid-19 vaccine is the first thing she's had in 10-12 years. She states that she will call her doctor but may not take anything if they prescribe it and will just wait and see if this will go away on its own. She also reported being able to see the difference in size. She reports she read online that these side effects are normal and is calling today to ask if these symptoms have been reported. Her right arm does not hurt all the time, just sometimes. She is asking if she should be concerned and see a doctor. Before she had her period, she felt heaviness in her right breast. It was not something she really noticed; it is there every month. But on Friday, 11Jun2021, she really noticed it. Her right breast felt heavier. It felt different while she was walking, and she was feeling heaviness on her right breast. The next day her right arm was not hurting, but today her arm is hurting hard. She has been trying to drink a lot of water and juice, hoping it will get better. She does not take medications. This is the first time she has taken any medication in 20 years. She states yesterday was a little better, but not much of a difference. There was a very little difference between today and yesterday. Her breast and arm hurt worse whenever she is walking. She is fine, she knows this is because of the vaccine. She is asking should she be concerned. She did not want it initially. Everyone was taking it. She was not sure if she was doing the right thing by not taking it. She works. She felt pressure from society and her family to take the covid vaccine. It took her a couple of weeks to decide if she should get it or not. She does not take medications. She was not sure if she should get the covid vaccine or not, and it was bothering her. The patient stated that she does not have any medical conditions to include. She does not have very good stamina. She gets tired easy. She is on a diet to maintain that. She is not a weak person; she goes on hikes. She must work on her balance. The patient was not recovered from the events.

First Vaccine Dose on 12/26/2020 felt extremely fatigued. After 2nd vaccine dose on 01/16/2021 developed fever, chills, weakness, fatigue, body aches approximately 10 hours after received the 2nd dose. This all lasted about 24 hours. Then on 01/19/2021 which was the 2nd day of mine menstrual cycle, I had a very abnormal menstruation. I was passing "fist" size blood clots which made me very weak. this lasted again about 24 hours then it stopped. I had some labs drawn on 02/27/2021 which came back with very low Iron, Hematocrit and Hemoglobin levels. I usually do show signs of anemia in previous blood work but this time the levels dropped lower so i was referred to see a Hematologist.
44 2021-03-15 menstrual disorder Menstrual cycle arrived one week early.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare ... Read more
Close
Menstrual cycle arrived one week early.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). This 44-year-old non-pregnant female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; lot number EN5318) via unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 05Feb2021 at 12:00 (at the age of 44-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had no medical history and was not allergic to medications, foods or other products. The patient did not have COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications included birth control pills from an unknown date for an unknown indication. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient reported that her menstrual cycle arrived one week early on 09Feb2021; further stating her period was not supposed to start until 16Feb(2021). The event was reported as non-serious and did not require hospitalization. No treatment was provided for the event. The outcome of menstrual cycle arrived one week early was recovering. It was also reported the patient had not been tested for COVID-19 since vaccination.

1 month after dose #2, I started having irregular periods. My menstrual cycles have always lasted 26 days, but in Feb and earlyMarch have lasted only 21 days, and then only 14!! In addition, my periods are lasting twice as long, with spotting in between. I am not pregnant, nor do I have any history of bleeding disorders. No increased bruising or other signs of thrombocytopenia.

24 hours after receiving the 1st dose vaccine I suffered from abdominal pain/cramping and vaginal bleeding. The vaginal bleeding was heavy at times and lasted for 60 hours. The abdominal pain continues as I fill this report out which is currently 72 hours. I was seen today by a gynecologist who performed a pap smear and ordered an ultra sound.

44 2021-04-07 menstruation irregular, intermenstrual bleeding My menstrual cycle runs like a clock. It was not due to happen until April 8th but I got it a week ... Read more
Close
My menstrual cycle runs like a clock. It was not due to happen until April 8th but I got it a week early. I am well aware of how each day goes in my cycle and the flow has been significantly off this cycle. The only variable was my vaccination shot. The injection site was sore, I got headaches and the site itched for days approx 48hrs after the shot. The cycle was almost like spotting for the first 2 days when normally the first 2-3 days are heavy. I am going on a week of the cycle and have only had 1 normal flow day yesterday when usually after 5 days the cycle is ending. Also had this odd burning spot on my chest and back but it only would last a few seconds.

Close
Severe swollen armpit on side of injection massive headaches fatigue and breast swelling on side of injection. Slight cough, throat closure feeling
44 2021-04-09 vaginal haemorrhage About 4 hours after the first vaccine, numbness and tingling all over the body. Left arm went comple... Read more
Close
About 4 hours after the first vaccine, numbness and tingling all over the body. Left arm went completely numb and tingling. Scalp tingling and numb. Felt like circulation was cut off. Severe Shortness of breath. Extreme feeling of adrenaline. The next day on March 14th, had extreme vaginal bleeding on day 14 of cycle. Bled for another 7 days which led to extreme anemia. The shortness of breath is every day since the first dose. Heart palpitations (heart rate went up to 190!). After the second dose on 4/03, all symptoms got worst. Left leg went completely numb the same day which I went to the emergency room for. The neurological tingling and numbness was spreading to my whole body. Arms, legs, face, ears, scalp, inside my head. I was worried for a heart attack since all of my symptoms of left arm and shoulder pain and numbness etc. I was released from the emergency room 12 hours later. I continued to have severe symptoms. The shortness of breath was so bad that I didn't sleep for 2 nights straight because my oxygen would drop. I also had severe insomnia and no appetite and lost 5 pounds in 1 week. Major adrenaline feeling. I went back to the emergency room 2 more times this week to check out my heart and lungs. All of my doctors recommended ER since they couldn't help me. My neurologist said he is getting lots of these symptoms from people post vaccine. My shortness of breath and elevated heart rate and numbness and tingling are still here and I can barely go up and down stairs without being out of breath and having a 130-140 heart rate and super low blood pressure and night sweats. It is awful.
44 2021-04-12 menstrual disorder, heavy menstrual bleeding Extremely abnormal heavy flow and clotting menstrual cycle.
44 2021-04-13 menstruation irregular Sore arm in the evening for a few hours on the day I received my vaccine. That was not concerning bu... Read more
Close
Sore arm in the evening for a few hours on the day I received my vaccine. That was not concerning but what was concerning is that my menstrual cycle started 2 weeks early (3 days after the shot). I may be in my forties but I am still very regular (have been for years and throughout this pandemic) so this is a big change for me. I am curious how my future menstrual cycles will be affected or if this is a one time deal (my hope).
44 2021-04-14 menstruation delayed My menstrual cycle is late. I had no idea this was a known side effect. I have reached out to other ... Read more
Close
My menstrual cycle is late. I had no idea this was a known side effect. I have reached out to other women on Social Media and most of them have reported the same issue with their menstrual cycle. Please make this known to every woman getting vaccinated. Despite the side effects, I am grateful for this vaccination. However knowing that my menstrual cycle might be disrupted would have avoided emotional anguish, wasting over a hundred dollars on pregnancy tests, and a major anxiety attack.
44 2021-04-18 menstruation irregular I had a off and on temperature/fever, chills, total body fatigue, headache, nausea, sinus and eye pa... Read more
Close
I had a off and on temperature/fever, chills, total body fatigue, headache, nausea, sinus and eye pain, and intense arm pain in vaccination arm (right) the day following the 2nd vaccination dose. On the second day my temperature regulated but I still had a headache, nausea, body fatigue. Noticed heart palpations intermediately throughout the day, while moving, lying down and sitting. On the third day still had a slight headache, slim body fatigue and noticed more consistent heart palpations. Also started my menstruation cycle on Saturday as well. Experienced more intense menstrual cramps than normal. It's the fourth day now and still feel the heart palpations more sporadically than yesterday and intense menstrual cramps. Please note that I already had a irregular heart beat prior too covid but I noticed a significant increase in the occurence of the heart palpations. Normally I only have them once a month or once very few months. This has been several times a day and on Sunday seemed to be experiencing hourly.

First dose: on second day had extreme exhaustion lasting two days. Second dose: began a very heavy menstrual cycle with clotting and 5x more bleeding than usual. This was just 5 days after ending regular cycle-approx 25 days earlier than normal. I am not or have not had any other changes that could possibly have affected my cycle aside from vaccine. I thoroughly researched and went over my medical/health/stress/activity and finally googled if it was possible or any others were known.

On 4/4/21, my symptoms continued and I developed more fatigue, fever, nausea, chills, early period, and abdominal pain. On 4/5/21, these side effects continued and the abdominal pain increased. On 4/6/21, ER determined that I developed acute appendicitis. My appendix ruptured and I had to have an appendectomy.

I am fine and required no treatment for this, but hearing about similar experiences I wanted to report this though some time has passed.
44 2021-04-24 breast swelling, menstruation delayed, breast mass PMS symptoms; nipples became very hard and sore.; swollen breast tissue; Menses late and hasn't star... Read more
Close
PMS symptoms; nipples became very hard and sore.; swollen breast tissue; Menses late and hasn't started; symmetrical lumps on the distal sides of my breasts; faint; slight injection site soreness; intense tingly whole body sensations; Sense of pressure and tingling on eyeballs; Increased sensitivity to touch; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient). A 44-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 30Mar2021 16:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included Mild/moderate TBI in Oct1999 with herniated disk in lower lumbar region from auto accident (patient was a pedestrian and a car ran into her); fractured tibia/fibula from occurrence; low blood pressure which she had occasionally fainted from at blood draws (started after being active athletically during recovery from 1999 injury). Patient was not pregnant. There were no concomitant medications (no vaccine in 4 weeks and no other medication in two weeks). Patient did faint 15 minutes after receiving Pfizer Covid vaccine on 30Mar2021. Medical people at vaccination site made a vasovagal note on record. Patient reported that there were no body aches or fatigue or fever, only slight injection site soreness for a couple of days which was hard to notice through intense tingly whole body sensations that started after receiving vaccine on 30Mar2021 16:15. Still continuing to feel a week and a half later. It was very uncomfortable but not painful. Patient also experienced sense of pressure and tingling on eyeballs and increased sensitivity to touch. Menses were due one week after vaccination but 4.5 days after vaccination on 03Apr2021, nipples became very hard and sore. After a few days on nipples slightly sore still but mostly swollen breast tissue with soreness on Apr2021. Patient had not had this as PMS symptom since becoming pregnant almost 9 years ago and it never lasted 7.5 days with it still ongoing as of time of report. Her menses was late on Apr2021 and hasn't started but she was not pregnant. Patient's usual PMS symptoms have kind of started yesterday on 09Apr2021. It quickly formed bilaterally symmetrical lumps on the distal sides of her breasts which was also unusual on Apr2021. No treatment was received and events results in doctor's clinic visit. Outcome of the events was not recovered. Patient was not diagnosed with covid prior to vaccination and had not been tested post vaccination. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the event syncope and the suspect suspect vaccine BNT162B2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer drug is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

My menstrual cycles have always been normal, but since the vaccines my periods are about two weeks apart and I am flowing incredibly heavy, unlike ever before! I have a rash on my left butt cheek that won?t go away and it feels like I have a rectal hemorrhoid. I am have been super tired and no energy. 44 2021-04-30 heavy menstrual bleeding passed out at work; abnormal (more than usual) vaginal bleeding; she felt uncomfortable on the morni... Read more
Close
passed out at work; abnormal (more than usual) vaginal bleeding; she felt uncomfortable on the morning of 05Apr2021; her hands and feet were cold; she was kind of sweating; she felt sick on 05Apr2021; her body temperature went up; her body felt warm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 44-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), second dose via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 04Apr2021 15:45 (3:45 PM) (Batch/Lot Number: ER8734) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history includes Shellfish Allergy (Reported she has had a shellfish allergy for a long time, approximately 7-8 years). She said as long as she had no shellfish, she was completely fine. There were no concomitant medications. There were no prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). There was no additional vaccine administered on the same date as the COVID-19 Vaccine. The patient previously took bnt162b2 for COVID-19 immunization on 14Mar2021 first dose intramuscular at the left arm (Lot Number: EN6208). It was reported that the patient has received both doses of the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine. Her second Pfizer Covid vaccine was received on 04Apr2021. Caller started her menstrual cycle on 07Apr2021. She experienced abnormal vaginal bleeding that night. The following day on 08Apr2021 she passed out at work and was transported to the ER via ambulance. She was advised by the ER provider that her symptom was not related to the Covid 19 vaccine. However, she spoke with her OBGYN and was advised they have heard that abnormal bleeding maybe caused by the Covid 19 vaccine. The patient asked if symptom has been reported? It was further reported that she had her first COVID-19 Vaccine shot on 14Mar2021, and her second COVID-19 Vaccine dose on 04Apr2021 at 3:45 PM (PST). She clarified later in the day on 04Apr2021, the COVID-19 Vaccine kicked in. She said she felt sick on 05Apr2021. She said she felt uncomfortable on the morning of 05Apr2021, but still went to work. She said she felt OK once she got to work, but then took time off from work (on 05Apr2021) because she felt uncomfortable. She said when she got home from work (on 05Apr2021), she took 2 Tylenol. She said she was cold, and her body temperature went up, and she was kind of sweating. She clarified her hands and feet were cold, and later in the day (05Apr2021) her body temperature went up. She said she was aware of the COVID-19 side effects because some of her friends had similar symptoms, so she was kind of expecting the symptoms. She said later in the evening on 05Apr2021, she took 2 Advil and went to bed. She said her body felt warm, but she thought her symptoms were to be expected. She said on 07Apr2021, her (menstrual) period started at 10:00 PM. She said she had abnormal (more than usual) vaginal bleeding for the whole night. She said on 08Apr2021, she felt uncomfortable in the morning when she was getting ready for work. She said she went to work (on 08Apr2021), and at 1:30 PM passed out while at work. She said from her work, she was sent by ambulance to the Emergency Room. She said she was not sure if her passing out had anything to do with the COVID-19 Vaccine, but she had never passed out at work before. She said she asked the Emergency Room doctor about the COVID-19 Vaccine and her passing out. She said the Emergency Room doctor said her passing out had nothing to do with her second COVID-19 Vaccine dose. She said she read more online about the COVID-19 Vaccine. She said she then asked the nurse at her OBGYN's office about abnormal bleeding after getting the COVID-19 Vaccine. She said the nurse had heard of some cases of abnormal bleeding after getting the COVID-19 Vaccine. She said her OBGYN's nurse told her to call to find out if her abnormal bleeding had anything to do with her second COVID-19 Vaccine. She said her OBGYN's nurse provided her with the number to get more information about the COVID-19 Vaccine. It was added that while she was at the Emergency Room, she had 7 vials of blood taken, 2 ultrasounds; an external one of her tummy (abdominal ultrasound), and an internal one where something was stuck in her (transvaginal ultrasound). She said she did not know the results of her testing, and was waiting for a copy of her medical records. The patient also weighed 165 lbs on an unspecified date. It was reported that for the treatment she had taken 2 Tylenol and 2 Advil at different times while at home, but was at work, and didn't have the Tylenol or Advil to provide the dosing, NDC, Lot, and Expiration Dates. For the Emergency Room treatment she reported an EKG was done, and she was given an IV drip. She said she was not sure what IV fluids were given to her. The patient required visit to Emergency Room and stated she was taken by ambulance on 08Apr2021 and discharged from the Emergency Room at 6:00 PM the same day. The patient also visited Physician Office and stated she went for a follow-up with her OBGYN doctor at between 9:00 AM-10:00 AM on 09Apr2021. She said the Emergency Room doctor had called her OBGYN doctor on 08Apr2021, while she was in the Emergency Room. The patient underwent laboratory tests which includes: EKG, Blood Test, Abdominal Ultrasound, Transvaginal Ultrasound (All tests were performed while at the Emergency Room on 08Apr2021. Patient stated she was waiting for a copy of her medical records with the test results). The outcome of the events was recovered on Apr2021.

Her period started 14 days early; Heavy bleeding (period); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 44-year-old female patient received BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, on an unspecified date, at the age of 44 years old, as single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was not pregnant at the time of the vaccination. The patient did not have COVID-10 prior to BNT162b2. There were no known allergies. The patient stated having received BNT162b2 two weeks prior to the initial reporting. She had been off of her period for about 7 days and she had 14 days before her period started again; her period started 14 days early, on 15Apr2021 at 16:30, which seemed weird to her. The patient felt like this was a side effect from the vaccine. The bleeding was described as heavy. The patient still had menstruation at the time of the reporting. The patient had not tested positive to COVID-19 after the vaccination. The outcome of the event irregular menstrual period was unknown, while the patient had not recovered from the heavy bleeding. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
The day after my second covid vaccine, I experienced fever, aches, headache, and chills. I expected that and understand it is a normal response. The other thing that has happened is I stopped having my menstrual cycles. I have not had a period in 3 months. My hormone levels show menopause. There was never any sign or symptom of menopause before receiving the vaccine.

44 2021-05-26 menstruation delayed This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (the patient). A 44-year-old female patient... Read more
Close
This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (the patient). A 44-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, ER8729) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 10Apr2021 09:30 at age of 44-year-old at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing endometriosis, allergy: penicillin and heavy periods pertains to her endometriosis. The patient had no concomitant medications (reported as "no other products"). The patient previously took the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number EN6203) via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 14Mar2021 at 09:30, at age of 44-year-old for COVID-19 immunization, with the first dose everything was fine, she had a little fatigue, but all fine. The patient had some symptoms that were normal and subsided. Caller had a delay in her menstrual cycle after her second dose on 30Apr2021 and was still delayed. She took pregnancy tests to rule out pregnancy. She was not irregular, that's why she did the test. She had heavy periods, cycles every 25-28 days and heaviness pertains to her endometriosis. It abnormal for her and she was thinking on behalf of her 14 year old daughter. Caller asked if the vaccine affecting girls that are menstruating and would it affect their fertility or delay or affect them in the long term. Caller would normally go through her normal OBG/GYN, but was referred to call Pfizer. Caller asked if other women called with similar experience, she was trying to get alleviated that it was normal. She obviously didn't care, she had her 4 kids. She didn't want her daughter to be dealing with this down the line. Caller was 4 days late, but was still in the window to get it on time. Caller felt this is important to report. Caller may be a week or so late. She took an iron supplement. Caller had nothing after the 1st dose. On 13Apr2021, she had fatigue, low grade fever, nausea for 2-3 weeks after the second dose with lower back pain. The nausea was a concern to caller because it didn't lift after a few days. She had read about it through the CDC, but had no symptoms until 2 days after. Caller's low back pain was centralized, middle of back, like tailbone, and has not resurfaced. Her temperature was like 100 degrees and lasted 24-48 hours, not as long as back pain and nausea. Caller had fatigue with her endometriosis and issues. She is still doing her normal routine, she was pretty fatigued that 2 weeks, and not like herself. Caller wanted to make sure and she got a pregnancy test, because the nausea hadn't lifted and the last time she felt that kind of sickness was with her pregnancy. The nausea stopped, but her period hasn't come. It was all the second dose. After the first dose, for 24-48 hours, she took it easy and monitored herself. She was lightheaded more with the whole 2 weeks and dizzy at times. She was not eating as well, her appetite was suppressed and she feels is was all related. It was on and off, but caller didn't document the exact dates, but she recovered from all the symptoms for the most part. Caller didn't expect a lengthy call, she was seeing if she experienced normal side effects and wanting to know about her daughter. The events did not require a visit to emergency room. Nausea and back pain fatigue and lightheaded require a visit to physician office. The outcome of events "nausea", "lower back pain" was recovered on 27Apr2021, the outcome of event "low grade fever" was recovered on 15Apr2021, the outcome of event "delayed menstrual cycle" was not recovered, the outcome of event "severe fatigue" was recovered in Apr 2021, the outcome of other events was recovered on an unspecified date.

44 2021-05-28 breast swelling I received the vaccine on Friday at 12pm. Late afternoon: fatigue, joint pain, swollen lymph nodes o... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine on Friday at 12pm. Late afternoon: fatigue, joint pain, swollen lymph nodes on left side of upper body, swollen left breast with pain and heaviness feeling that lasted for 2-3 days, Lupus butterfly rash on face, flu-like symptoms, spike in temperature to 100º, dizziness, heat radiating off body, and migraine. I took my prescribed Meloxican (for Lupus joint/muscle pain) approx 2:30pm and then my prescribed Fioricet for the migraine. Friday evening: Approximately 8pm I broke out in hives on my trunk; stomach, chest, shoulders, and back. The migraine worsened to include nausea with sensitivity to light, sound and smell. I took my prescribed Zomeg with no relief. The migraine was so severe that it kept me in bed with pain for hours that once I had some relief to be able to stand to go look in the mirror at the hives, it was approximately 1am. I put hydrocortisone cream on the areas I could reach and took Benadryl. It took over an hour to fall asleep. Saturday: I took Allegra. The hives were still prominent and itchy. Sunday: The hives were still there but most were on my shoulders and back, while some still remained on my stomach but not as prominent. The hives were still itchy. The other symptoms have subsided except the migraine, which was dull, and fatigue. Monday: The hives were not as prominent but somewhat itchy. They were some remaining on my shoulders. They other symptoms subsided with the exception of a dull migraine which I managed with Fioricet. I made the first available appointment with my primary doctor. Tuesday: I saw my primary doctor. Per my physician I still have hives on my trunk. I was instructed to continue with interventions. As of 5/19/2021, I had been treating the hives, fatigue, and migraines which occurred unexpectedly. The hives have subsided completely by Thursday, 5/20/2021.

Many other women have reported this same issue but it still has not been addressed or acknowledged publicly or privately by the CDC. My concerns and questions are: 1. What studies have you performed in regards to covid vaccine and women's periods? 2. What permanent side effects will this cause to my cycle and ability to have children? 3. Will my periods normalize back to what they were before I received the vaccine? 4. Will I need medical treatment? 5. Does the vaccine cause premature menopausal symptoms? 6. I could not move my head without significant spinning sensation. The vertigo has now subsided. I have never experienced vertigo in my life. It was debilitating. Thankfully it has subsided. Close
irregular periods; Got period again; Arm was a little sore; This is a spontaneous report from contactable consumer. This 44-year-old female patient reported for herself that she received her first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number: EW0177, Expiry date: 31Aug2021) via an unspecified route of administration into the right arm on 06Jun2021 (at the age of 44-year-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received her second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number: UNKNOWN, Expiry date: 30Sep2021) via an unspecified route of administration into the right arm on 30Jun2021 at 11 AM as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. No prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. On an unspecified date, the patient experienced irregular periods. 0n 06Jun2021, her arm was a little sore and on 24Jun2021, she got periods again. Within 4-5 hours after vaccination, the right arm was getting sore, later in the evening there was minor soreness. She knew that the second shot would be worse. She was able to deal with the discomfort through the night. That day, her right arm was visibly pulsating and twitching. She explains that she can move her arm halfway up freely, otherwise if she moves it up any further the pulsating was worse. Pain really was not an issue. She has experienced irregular periods since her first dose of the Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine. She has had two periods in a month since her first dose Jun2021. Referred to HCP for continued evaluation and treatment. She reported that the first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine was totally fine. Later, in the evening before going to bed, her arm was a little sore. It was nothing major and went away the second day. On 01Jul2021, obviously her arm was still sore, but now a throbbing was happening and inquired if that was normal. If she just puts her arm down, her arm was almost pulsating like a heart. The pulsating was not hurting, it was just weird. The reason that she waited a few days before getting the second dose of the Covid-19 vaccine is because she got her period twice in Jun2021. She had her period on 01Jun2021 and then got the shot on 05Jun2021 and her period was over. Then she got her period again in Jun2021 and that never happens to her. She got her period on 24Jun2021 again and said that she was not going to be on her period getting the second Covid-19 shot. Her period completed on 28Jun2021, but she waited until 30Jun2021 to get the second dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. The patient was taking Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine to protect her family. Outcome was unknown for event irregular periods. Outcome was resolved for events arm was a little sore on 07Jun2021 and got period again on 28Jun2021. Caller reported that a couple of hours after receiving the second dose of the Covid-19 vaccine, immediately after 4-5 hours, she felt the shot in her arm. She still has soreness in her arm. With the soreness, it kind of hurts to move her arm but it was nothing excruciating. She could not really lift her arm up high or anything, but it was getting better. Arm was throbbing: It was pulsing even her child can see it and it just started happening and had never seen anything like that. She needed to call somebody because that was just weird. Follow up(01Jul2021): This is a follow up spontaneous report from contactable consumer. This 44- years- old female (Patient) reported for herself which included product details. Additional information has been requested.

arm swelled; My armpit swelled to size of abaseball.; I had extreme pain at theinjection site,; My groin was also painful to the touch; strange numbing sensation andweakness throughout my left side; strange numbing sensation andweakness throughout my left side; My heart raced for about 10 minutes after shot; weakness and tinglingin my arm to my fingertips; tingling in my arm to my fingertips; felt dizzy; muscle spasms on my left side into my face.; my breasts are super tender; I just feel off; foggy headed; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 44-year-old non- pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: En6208) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 16Mar2021 at 14:15 (at the age of 44-years-old) as a dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), a really insignificant low platelet count disorder. The patient had a broken foot and a touchy stomach but that was not a real health concern. The patient was not tested allergic to anything other than pollen. It was unknown whether, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications were reported as no. The patient did not receive any other vaccines in four weeks prior to COVID-19 vaccination. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 16Mar2021 at 14:15, the patient felt heart racing for about 10 minutes after shot. The patient had weakness and tingling in the arm to fingertips. The patient also felt mild dizzy. About 24 hours later on 17Mar2021, the patient noticed arm swelling and armpit was swollen to the size of a baseball. The patient had extreme pain at the injection site radiating down the arm and to the left side of the breast. The patient hated the strange numbing sensation and weakness throughout the left side. The patients groin was also painful to the touch. After a week on an unknown date in Mar2021 the swelling had gone down, but the patient had totally random and uncontrollable muscle spasms on the left side of the face. The shot site continued to hurt and the breasts were super tender. The patient felt off and foggy headed. The patient was unsure about taking the second dose. The patient was scared and did not know what to do and also did not want to not get it. strange numbing sensation and weakness throughout my left side. The adverse events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the swelling arm, axillary mass were recovering, and the clinical outcome of the events heart racing, weakness in arms, tingling, dizzy, injection site pain, numbness, groin pain, muscle spasms, breast tenderness, feeling down and foggy headed, strange numbing sensation and weakness throughout my left side was not resolved at the time of this report. Amendment (26Mar2021): This follow-up report is being submitted to amend previously reported information: Additional PMH "low platelet count disorder" added. Events Physician office visit ticked. Additional coding of "Weakness left or right side" for event "strange numbing sensation and weakness throughout my left side" added, 1st Vaccine letter for NON-HCP initiated. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.

It's was more painful and heavier.; Her period came one week earlier than planned. It's was more painful and heavier.; Chills; Sore throat; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 45-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE lot/batch number: EJ1685), via an unspecified route of administration on 21Dec2020 at SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing chronic migraines. Concomitant medications included ascorbic acid (VIT C), and ergocalciferol (VIT D). On 21Dec2020, the patient received the vaccine. After 48 hours (23Dec2020), she had chills, and a sore throat but no fever. It was mentioned that the chills and sore throat just lasted for one day. On 03Jan2021, the patient mentioned that her period came one week earlier than planned. It's was more painful and heavier. She mentioned that she always had a difficult period, but this this one seems more intensified (10 times) and was very painful. It was mentioned that the patient was getting the second one next week. The patient recovered from chills and sore throat on 24Dec2020 while not recovered for the remaining events
45 2021-01-25 vaginal haemorrhage vaginal bleeding; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient) via Medical inform... Read more
Close
vaginal bleeding; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient) via Medical information team. A 45-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3248), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 08Jan2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient have family history of diabetes mellitus from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took Vitamin B12 [cyanocobalamin] and experienced allergy rash and levothyroxine for hypothyroidism for more than a year. The patient received the first dose of the vaccine on 08Jan2021 at 11:20 or 11:25AM and at around 3 PM, she had noticed some vaginal bleeding. She thought it was her period but it stopped during the night (she mentioned she worked that night). She asked if this was a side effect from the vaccine. It was light, like when a person's period was coming but it was a brownish color, not red. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. No treatment given to the patient for the event. The outcome of the event was recovered on 08Jan2021.

A 45-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL8982 and expiration date not provided), intramuscular in the left arm on 14Jan2021 12:30 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypertension (HTN) and hypothyroidism. The patient is not pregnant. The patient has no know allergies. There were no concomitant medications. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine and no other medications in two weeks. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. On 15Jan2021 02:45, the patient experienced nausea, left upper arm/underarm/breast swelling and pain, headache nothing would take away, body aches at the slightest touch, fever, loss of appetite lasting 4 days and still with nausea, loss of appetite and headache. Treatment was not provided in response to the events. The outcome of the events was recovered with sequelae on an unspecified date in Jan2021. Close
The next day I had a low grade fever. The highest was 100.9. I took Aleve for my period cramps and Tylenol around 2pm. Around midnight I took Motrin, 600mg. The next morning, my temp was normal. I then had back and arm pain. The arm pain was like a nerve pain. I called my PCP on the 11th. Dr. said she thought it was idiopathic brachial plexopathy. She prescribed Prednisone at 50mg and tapered down over 4 weeks. I had an MRI of my brachial plexus and that showed inflammation. I rested my arm for 4 weeks and then I started physical therapy this week. I will be seeing another neurologist next week that specializes in neuromuscular disorders. He might order a nerve study.

45 2021-04-10 heavy menstrual bleeding, menstruation irregular I got the 1st dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine on day 3 of my period. Normally I have very regular ... Read more
Close
I got the 1st dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine on day 3 of my period. Normally I have very regular periods that end completely by day 7. But since getting the vaccine, my period has lasted for 14 days with no signs of stopping. On day 13, for a few hours I bled so heavily that I went to urgent care. Since it was Saturday night and they're a small clinic, they couldn't conduct any real lab tests and I must wait till Monday to see my obgyn. Prior to getting the vaccine, I NEVER had this much excess bleeding, and I never bled longer than 7 days (now it's been 14 days and counting) I am alarmed that the vaccine has clearly affected the length and intensity of my menstrual cycle, and no doctor seems to know why.

Close
Initially, I felt fine. Several hours later I began to feel run down, like a cold. I then began to have an ache near my right kidney that I attributed to laying weirdly. However, I also began experiencing a sort of menstrual cramping on my right side as well. This has persisted since Friday night. Today (4/12/21) at about 02:30 pm, I got my period 10 days early! This isn't normal for me. Right now it is as if I'm spotting (dark discharge to warn that full-on bleeding will happen soon). I don't usually spot. My period is rather predictable and I have been dutiful in my tracking as my cycle has shortened over the years, going from a 28 day to 25 day cycle. The malaise and aches are consistent with my PMS, but I just wasn't expecting my period right now. I really don't understand how this is happening.

Since then, I keep feeling like I'm about to get my period with light cramping, bloating and fatigue. Today I am experiencing spotting. (Tomorrow will be 2 weeks since I received my first Pfizer dose). As I haven't had a period for 2 years, I'm not sure if the timing is in keeping with when I would have had a period. It feels to me like it's connected to the vaccine. I have not seen a doctor as the symptom isn't that bad, just surprising.

I had my first dose of Covid vaccine, Pfizer 30ug at 3:40pm on 4/8/21. 1 day after my first dose I started have low fever(98.8-99.2f). 2 days after my first dose of Covid vaccine my left breast start being painful and start whole body ache. 4 days after first dose my left breast start having an half egg size painful touchable lump with red, warm and swelling. I started taking Acetaminophen 10 mg bid. 4 days on 4/11 till today after first dose for both pain control and reducing body temperature. I used to have granulomatous mastitis on my right breast which is self limited and I had not have this problem for one year. Although the mechanism is still unclear but some theory of this disease is more like an autoimmune problem. I doubt somehow this vaccine has too strong immunogenicity, or at least which is too strong for me. I was getting Pfizer which is 30ug I think. Possibility: 1 Too large dose for my body size (120 lb) 2 Some adjuvant in this Pfizer vaccine induces too strong cellular immune response which may initiate or help for some none Covid specific antibody production, unfortunately for some patients who have autoimmune disease are triggered by this vaccine then they may start producing autoimmune antibody which start self attacking.

45 2021-05-11 menstrual disorder, abnormally short menstrual cycles, menstruation irregular, heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual cramps At the time of my first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine, I was at the end of my menstrual cycle. 8 days... Read more
Close
At the time of my first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine, I was at the end of my menstrual cycle. 8 days following the first dose, I began bleeding again. Unlike a monthly cycle, the bleeding was light in color ?watered-down? and bright red and appeared as a ?fresh wound? vs clotting- type blood during a monthly cycle. The bleeding required sanitary pads and tampons. The bleeding continued for 4 days. Three weeks after the first dose and two weeks after the start of the aforementioned irregular bleeding , my menstruation cycle began again. The cycle was heavy, with cramping. The cycle lasted 7 days. I felt it was necessary to report this because my cycle is normally 30-32 days and has been since having children 11 years ago. I do not spot mid cycle and have no instances of an ?early period?. I have not missed a period except in pregnancy. I?m what is considered ?regular?. I do not suffer from anxiety, I?m not afraid of vaccines or needles and have not experienced weight gain or loss. I mention this because I have read these factors could potentially the cause of unusual menstruation related to the COVID vaccine

breakthrough bleeding/Bleeding heavily with large clots; period started 1 day later with breakthrough bleeding; nausea; headache; lethargic; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 45-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: ew0169), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 17Apr2021 at 13:45 (at the age of 45-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history reported as no. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included probiotic (probiotics nos); daily vitamins; birth control pills. The patient previously received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: er8730), administered in left arm on 27Mar2021 at 10:00 AM (at the age of 45-year-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced nausea, headache and lethargic, all on 17Apr2021; and period started 1 day later (18Apr2021) with breakthrough bleeding. Bleeding heavily with large clots beginning 25Apr2021 and still happening 4 days later. Normal period lasts 6 days with 2 heavy days, 3 regular days and one light day. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

45 2021-06-20 heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual disorder My periods are always regular, in terms of length, and in terms of amount of blood. I generally woul... Read more
Close
My periods are always regular, in terms of length, and in terms of amount of blood. I generally would have about 2 - 4 hours of heavy blood per period (total period lasting 4 days). After the second dose, the 2nd and 3rd day of my period were extremely bloody (menhorragia) for the full two days. I was soaking through super tampons or super Thinx underwear in an hour. The clots were larger and more plentiful than usual, and the blood had a different quality -the blood itself was very thin and watery, with the clots being thick and gelatinous. By the third day of my period, the menhorragia had returned to a normal amount.

My periods are always regular, in terms of length, and in terms of amount of blood. I generally would have about 2 - 4 hours of heavy blood per period (total period lasting 4 days). After the first dose (and before the 2nd dose), the 3rd and 4th day of my period were extremely bloody (menhorragia) for the full two days. I was soaking through super tampons or super Thinx underwear in an hour. The clots were larger and more plentiful than usual, and the blood had a different quality -the blood itself was very thin and watery, with the clots being thick and gelatinous. My period is always over by Day 5, but this cycle, I bled for an extra day.

45 2021-07-12 heavy menstrual bleeding Unexpected menorrhagia (heavy menstrual bleeding) with large (larger than half dollars) clots within... Read more
Close
Unexpected menorrhagia (heavy menstrual bleeding) with large (larger than half dollars) clots within 12 hours of receiving both the 1st and the 2nd Pfizer covid vaccine shots. (My periods are typically mostly normal and even though I have had heavy bleeding in the past on a few occasions, I've never experienced anything like this before.) After the 2nd shot, in addition to the menorrhagia, I also woke up the next morning with a large (about the size of a dime) subconjunctival hemorrhage in my right eye, at the top center portion of the sclera. It is mostly hidden underneath my eyelid, but is visible when I pull my eyelid back or when I look down or to the sides. (I have never had one of these before and it scared me, so I made an appointment to have it checked out.) Also, after the second shot, I have been experiencing bleeding gums when I brush or floss my teeth, which is also something new and unexpected and not something I typically or have ever experienced. It has now been 6 days since the second shot and I am still bleeding (heavy period bleeding with large clots), my right eye still has the large bloody spot (about the size of a dime), but thankfully my gums have stopped bleeding.

I had my past menstrual period starting 1/18/2021 and received the vaccine the next day 1/19/2021. Now, as today 2/3/2021 I started to have my menstrual period again (just 2 weeks after the previous menstrual period) I always have my menstrua periods regularly every 26 to 28 days. I am planning to have a CBC test done. I suspect that my platelets are low again. I want to make sure the vaccine is not causing me thrombocytopenia and to report this event for future data collection.
