56 2021-05-13 breast swelling Approximately one week after my first COVID shot, a cyst that had been present for decades on my rig... Read more
Close
Approximately one week after my first COVID shot, a cyst that had been present for decades on my right breast without any problems swelled up and abscessed. Wound cultures were negative for any growth, so it appears to have been some sort of inflammatory issue, possibly a Sjogren's flare triggered by the COVID shot.
56 2021-05-22 postmenopausal haemorrhage Post menopausal bleeding. I do not know if this is vaccine-related.
56 2021-05-23 vaginal haemorrhage, heavy menstrual bleeding, menstrual cramps After the first vaccine, I had the expected headache, fatigue, slightly sore arm, slight nausea, and... Read more
Close
After the first vaccine, I had the expected headache, fatigue, slightly sore arm, slight nausea, and headache which lasted a couple of days. I then developed what felt like menstrual cramping and acidic stomach pain, but I hadn't had a menstrual cycle in seven months, and only two in the past two years. On the 11th day after my vaccination, I had very light bleeding for a day. I didn't connect it to my being vaccinated at all. In the past, I always experienced acidic stomach pain right before my period. I was concerned about cancer so made an OB appointment right away. I didn't see her until two weeks after my second vaccine. I was given the second dose three weeks later on April 21, 2021, and the morning after I had the same side effects as with the first dose--headache, fatigue, slightly sore arm, slight nausea, and headache. Two days later on April 23rd, I began having vaginal bleeding again, only three weeks after the first vaccine. The bleeding was very heavy and lasted for ten days--longer than any vaginal bleeding I'd ever had and much heavier in flow.

On Monday the next the swelling is not the same but as of today I am still swollen and have a different pain it's more of a constance ache and shooting pain to my nipple on this right side (2021). armpit and breast very swollen. The patient had no known allergies.The patient previously received first dose of bnt162b2(lot number: ER8732) at arm left on 31Mar2021 04:30PM at the age of 56-year-old for covid-19 immunisation. The event was recovered on 08May2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, the reported event post menopausal vaginal bleeding one week after the second dose more likely represented intercurrent illness, but not related to bnt162b2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Committees, and investigators, as appropriate.

On 16Mar2021, Pap (Smear cervix) was negative. On 16Mar2021, ultrasound showed endometrial thickness within normal range 4 mm, 2 small fibroids 1 cm, 2 cm, normal ovary sizes, small L ovarian cyst. I have not had a period in over 2 years. I received the shot on April 7th. On April 8th I started to see blood when I went to the bathroom. On April 11th I had period like symptoms, clotting, big chunks that is still continuing as of today April 30th. I have been to several doctors to figure out why the bleeding is happening and the doctors can not find anything wrong and have recommend hysterectomy. I was given medroxyprogesterone 10 milligrams to be taken for 10 days starting April 13th for 10 days 3 times a day. Then reduce down to 1 time a day. On day 10 I reduced down to 1 a day and the bleeding came back to soaking one extra large pad in less than 30 minuets. The doctor told me to continue on three a day till the bleeding tampered off. 57 2021-06-02 postmenopausal haemorrhage, heavy menstrual bleeding Postmenopausal Menstruation, bleeding and cramping; Small lump in the inner thigh; inappropriate sch... Read more
Close
Postmenopausal Menstruation, bleeding and cramping; Small lump in the inner thigh; inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered; Extreme premenstrual syndrome in breast and under armpits and under lymph nodes; Passing small blood clots; started having periodic premenstrual symptoms, like cramps; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 58-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EW0151), via an unspecified route of administration on 07Apr2021 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included cysts (fibrocystic cysts in her breast and a baker's cyst behind the knee many years ago), Ovarian surgery, blood pressure and blood potassium. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient stated that she read an article online about the women who took the Pfizer vaccine should report if they were having menstrual issues. She stated that she took her first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on 13Apr2021, and on 12May2021 she started having periodic premenstrual symptoms, like cramps. She stated that she has her regular menstrual cycle now, and she had cancelled her second dose. Because of her side effects she put off her 3 week booster shot that was scheduled for 28Apr2021 at 1400. She did not show up and was waiting to hear from a couple physicians regarding a lump on her inner right thigh that was moving around. She had trouble finding it the next day. She checked the other side to see if it had to do with fat composition or whatnot. It disappeared and she did follow up with her primary physician on it. Her primary physician said that if it had been a blood clot, she would have felt pain, but was not sure about that. Patient stated that she has not been able to find the lump. The patient's physician said that the patient could reschedule the vaccination as she could have it within 42 days. The patient stated that about a week and a half ago, she experienced extreme premenstrual syndrome in her breast and under her armpits and under her lymph nodes, cramping on monday and tuesday and some time yesterday, and the last 2 days she has been passing small blood clots like menstrual. The patient stated that the PMS has subsided somewhat. The patient has been taking ibuprofen. She has not had PMS or a period for at least 5 years. Last night, the patient stated that she was on the internet reading articles regarding the Covid vaccination and menstruation issues, and it is being reported but not fully. The patient described as: it seems like they were trying to keep it hush. The patient had side effects so bad over the weekend, the past weekend. The patient scheduled an appointment with a gynecologist whom she will visit in the middle of June because of these symptoms. The patient stated that she was afraid that she will get a mammogram and was not sure what's going on. Patient described that it was a kind of weird. The patient noticed the lump around approximately 24Apr2021 or 25Apr2021. It would have been between 2 and 3 weeks after the first shot, not even 3 weeks. The patient stated that she visited her physician in the first week of May and told her physician that she was having trouble finding it, then she felt it and didn't feel it again. It made her very queasy the first time she felt it. The patient stated that she had cysts in the past. She had fibrocystic cysts in her breast and a baker's cyst behind the knee many years ago. The patient stated that the cysts felt weird like soft and were moving around. It made her queasy. The patient stated that she has had the premenstrual syndrome in her breast and under her armpits and under her lymph nodes for at least a week. She used to get this during her monthly cycle during that time, she forgot what they call is severe PMS. The patient stated that she was going through very severe PMS just like that up until 2015. There was a year she had an ovarian mass removed and her fallopian tubes. She only has one ovary left. Once her period went away it went away. She never suffered, maybe slight PMS until she was fully into menopause. It has been this last week. She couldn't get out of bed because she had cramping and was in pain. She never used to cramp except in high school. The patient sated that she doesnt really feel lumps in her lymph nodes, it is just very tender and her nipples were highly sensitive. Underneath and along her rib cage and under her armpits is very warm to the touch. It is like a very bad premenstrual syndrome. It is definitely not warm or hot anymore, it has gotten better. The swelling has gone down, and she last noticed any blood clotting last evening and the clots were tinier like little dots. The blood clots started on monday 17May2021. The patient had cramps when she was in bed in the morning, then after she took pain medicine it subsided. The patient stated that she had no cramping today. The first time she had cramping was Monday 17Apr2021. The last time she had cramps was yesterday. The worst was on tuesday on 18May2021. Tuesday night was the worst for the blood clots too. She doesn't know. She hadn't had them for 5 years then it came upon recently. She doesn't know if she has recovered completely. She doesn't know if the cramps or the blood clots will return. If it goes like a normal cycle like before pre-menopause it will go away and then come back the next month. The patient stated that after she urinated today, she did not see any blood, and she was not using a pad. The blood clots have pretty much cleared up. The patient stated that she was reading and looking on the internet at ingredients and it was so scary and she was really scared. Patient stated that it was 42 days since her first dose. It would have been 42 days yesterday within the time limit to have the second shot of the booster. Now it is the forty third day and she has not had it. She was reading that it can be given 90 to 120 days. She is getting mixed messages. The people she lives with are high risk, and that's the only reason she got it. The case was assessed as serious. The patient stated that she was taking Ibuprofen and her symptoms subsided somewhat. Treatment was taken for events. The outcome of the events was resolved for cramps and resolving for other events. Information for lot number has been requested.

It got worse, and she went to all kinds of different doctors, including PCP, hormone, and plastic surgery. Was told by several docs that it was because of the vaccine. Worried about side effects or if the swelling will return. She asks if she waits too long, is her body going to overreact, or are there any complications or interactions between the 2 doses for those people? States her boobs are swelling, went to her doctor where she had the surgery, on the 14Apr2021, gynecologist told her it was related to the Covid 19 vaccine. States its been 11 weeks since she had the first dose, is second dose contraindicated, is it too late. States as of two weeks ago the swelling went down. States she is rushing, she trying to work, already missed a lot of work for this, just wants an answer to her questions. Clarifies she wants to know if it is too late to get her second dose, is it contraindicated, what is the guidance now for how to proceed. The outcome of the events was unknown. Post menopausal vaginal bleeding; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number: Lot Number: ER8737), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left arm on 06Apr2021 at 10:30 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 11Apr2021 at 08:00, the patient experienced post menopausal vaginal bleeding. The patient did not receive treatment for the event. The outcome of the event was not recovered.
59 2021-05-16 vaginal haemorrhage Patient is menopausal and experienced vaginal bleeding lasting about 2 days. Heavy enough bleeding ... Read more
Close
Patient is menopausal and experienced vaginal bleeding lasting about 2 days. Heavy enough bleeding that required a pad, but it did not saturate the pad.
59 2021-05-30 menstrual disorder I had the fist shot in the arm that had the surgery, within 10 minutes I was in a lot of pain were ... Read more
Close
I had the fist shot in the arm that had the surgery, within 10 minutes I was in a lot of pain were the surgery was preformed. Felt like it went to my joints such as my knees. Chills, weak and been unusually tired, this never went away. My second Covid shot was May 13, the same thing happened same arm, 10-15 minutes later pain shoots down my arm to my wrist where the surgery was performed. Then my joints, so much pain brought me to my knees in tears. Experienced chills and ached all over Exhausted with periods its hard to stay awake. Now I feel like it has settled in my joints especially my knees where fibromyalgia is the worst, I need an cane to walk. I received ab cortisone shot in each knee on 5/21/21. no help, now my right calf hurts to walk even with cane. On May 26 I started my period. I havent had an period in 6 years, I'm 59 years old.
59 2021-06-09 pelvic pain found on the floor between the toilet and wall.; Shortness of breath; has a cough and is bring up co... Read more
Close
found on the floor between the toilet and wall.; Shortness of breath; has a cough and is bring up cold stuff; She was so sick; Diarrhea; Chills; Fever; Nausea; Headache; couldn't get out of bed; remembered getting up and going to the bathroom but doesn't remember much after that; She was told she was allergic to the shot; pain in pelvis area; she was dehydrated; she was not able to give urine; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration, administered into the arm on 01May2021 (at the age of 59-year-old) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease for 5 years, ongoing asthma for 5 years and smoking. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 03May2021, patient was reportedly so sick, she was having diarrhea, chills, fever, nausea, headache and couldn't get out of bed; the patient remembered getting up and going to the bathroom but doesn't remember much after that, her husband found her on the floor between the toilet and wall. The ambulance was called and patient was brought to the emergency room. Patient was told that she was allergic to the shot. Patient underwent MRI and X-ray to check her pelvis because she was in pain in the pelvis area but with unknown results on 03May2021. It was reported that due to dehydration she was not able to give urine on 03May2021. It was also reported that on 03May2021 she had shortness of breath, has a cough and is bring up cold stuff, that is why she was using a breathing machine. The patient received treatment for the events "found on the floor between the toilet and wall", "she was dehydrated", "she was not able to give urine" and "Nausea"; patient was kept for 12-13 hours in the emergency room treated with antibiotics and other medications. Outcome of events "shortness of breath", "has a cough and is bring up cold stuff", "headache" was recovering; events "found on the floor between the toilet and wall", "she was so sick", "remembered getting up and going to the bathroom but doesn't remember much after that", "she was dehydrated", "she was not able to give urine" and "was told that she was allergic to the shot" recovered on an unspecified date; the outcome of all other events recovered on an unspecified date in May2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
59 2021-06-22 menstrual disorder, postmenopausal haemorrhage She also had the bleeding under control; She also reported having a period for a week when she has b... Read more
Close
She also had the bleeding under control; She also reported having a period for a week when she has been in menopause for 10 years; She has been having on and off fatigue; Nausea; Headache; Bloating; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (reported for herself). A 59-years-old female patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 25May2021 (at the age of 59-years-old) as 2nd dose, single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2; PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), first dose via an unspecified route of administration on 04May2021 (at the age of 59-years-old) as 1st dose, single dose for covid-19 immunisation. On an unspecified date, the patient reported that when it started to go downhill. She had been having on and off fatigue, nausea, headache and bloating. She experiences these for 3-4 days out of every week. She has self-medicated with Aspirin and Tylenol. She also reported having a period for a week when she had been in menopause for 10 years. She also had the bleeding under control as she also self-medicated as she cannot get a hold of her gynecologist and it has been frustrating. it has been 6 weeks. The patient is asking whether if this is normal and how long will she experience these. She also added that she doesn't have a primary health care physician and only a gynecologist. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events with Aspirin and Tylenol. The event the She also had the bleeding under control was assessed as serious (medically significant). The outcome of the events was not resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
59 2021-06-30 postmenopausal haemorrhage I had a period 21 days after first vaccine even though I am post menopausal and have been for 6 year... Read more
Close
I had a period 21 days after first vaccine even though I am post menopausal and have been for 6 years.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer ( patient reported herself ). A 59-years-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number:ER8727, expiry date:unknown), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 22May2021 at 09:15 (at age of 59-years-old) (DOSE 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history included AC nodal re-entry tachycardia 1991/1993-Heart ablations corrected the rhythm issue and non-small cell adenocarcinoma in right lung 2015.Concomitant medication included calcium carbonate, cholecalciferol (VITAMIN D 2000). The patient previously took midazolam, epinephrine, diphenhydramine, levofloxacin, penicillin and dibromoglutaronitrile, c. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to covid-19 vaccination. The most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered at Hospital. The patient is not pregnant at time of vaccination. On 14Jun2021 at 15:45, the patient reported she had a period 21 days after first vaccine even though her post-menopausal and have been for 6 years. The reporter assessed the event as non serious.The event outcome was recovering.
